review_text: What an excellent stick, smooth, rich and legs for years...

title: San Cristobal de La H.  Muralla
review_text: Absolutely marvellous.Rich cocoa and pepper flavours.Plenty of smoke.8 years of ageing make wonders.

title: San Cristobal de La H.  Muralla
review_text: I hapened to buy a box at SH airport with 10% discount becasue someone had stloen one stick before. I have to say the wrap isnot as good as before, but the flavor is amzing. Very lucky decision. Only will draw it on special occassions.

title: Rafael Gonzalez M.  Slenderellas
review_text: A very nice cigar though it has a extremely tight draw and only the faintest wisps of smoke come out from it. The flavor was immediately after lighting a good medium with plenty of rich aged tobacco, chocolate and coffee notes and a slight grassy herbalness too it. If the draw was better it would be 5 stars but at the moment 3 is the best I can give it.

title: Rafael Gonzalez M.  Slenderellas
review_text: A very pretty slim cigar, giving of complex range of flavors, albeit in a very subtle way. Medium in strength, starting with herbaceous notes, progressing to coffee beans and ending with oriental spices. A real treat for a slow afternoon smoke.Amman airport carries a good stock of these beauties.

title: Rafael Gonzalez M.  Slenderellas
review_text: One of the most subtle cigars I have ever smoked. On the light side, but citrus and rose flavours throughout. Extremely mellow, easy to frequently exhale through the nose. Some gum arabic and bean flavours as well, but one of the most floral smokes ever, even within the Rafael Gonzales marca.

title: Rafael Gonzalez M.  Slenderellas
review_text: Hola. As far as I know, the cigar is no longer available. I had time enough to find an almost forgotten open box in a Spanish Estanco with four cigars. I can imagine how dificult was rolling this pencil-sized cigar, good exam for rollers. Considering this is a cigar to enjoy relaxed and slowly, I had no draw problems smoking it, aged enough to avoid such problems. Medium strength and rich flavours, very classic cigar. I imagine a quite fashionable vitola years ago. Good Bye RGM Slenderella, you gave nice smokes along your era.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Cedros de Luxe No. 1
review_text: Just finished one of these from a box I got from Cuba. Nice 50 minute smoke. Good flavour with a hint of spiciness and smooth taste. Burned well right up to final inch then canoed slightly. Good cigar and enjoyable. Ash is firm and smoke is abundant.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Cedros de Luxe No. 1
review_text: Beginning scent is lovely sweet. Starts a bit tight and the draw is tight. Faint taste of cedar. Middle develops a hint of sugar and the cigar opens up with lots of smoke. The end is stronger to taste: malt, chocolate, cedar. All in all for a cigar about seven years old I expected the stick to be tastier, yet it seems the tobacco has developed smoothly.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Cedros de Luxe No. 1
review_text: an awesome flavor and aroma but rolled way too tight for a very hard draw. massaging the cigar gently improves the draw. Nice rich cedar and spice taste and aroma.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Cedros de Luxe No. 1
review_text: Tried a single stick from the 02 after painstakingly bringing it back to life in my humidor. It was quite dry when I purchased it on a whim a number of months back, one of the few remaining of the box. The absence of any prelit aroma did not bode well but I proceeded undeterred. The first half was quite sweet. Caramel notes with sweet fruit balancing well with the spice, almost like smoking a Cameroon wrapper. Flavours intermingle with chocolate and blackpepper. Quite complex and medium-light in body. As the stick progresses, the flavour profile become drier and savoury. Now there is toast, leather and some saltiness reminiscent of a Sancho Panza. The sweet cedar now becomes mellow woodiness. Some intermittent herbal notes and mint, occasional meaty nuaces. Spice levels die down but the smoke becomes increasingly richer, more fuller bodied. Long aftertaste of wood and toasted tobacco. Burns evenly yielding dense white ash. Towards the final quarter, the spice increases. A constantly evolving stick with much complexity. Not a typical RyJ but thorouhgly enjoyable. An experience more so than just a casual smoke. I find it odd that people rate it so lowly.

title: Punch  Souvenir Deluxe MM
review_text: Very different from Handmade, Spicy. Comparatively boring taste.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Sports Largos
review_text: A delicious cigar. The construction was good with a good amount of resistance. on the opening light cream  carrying mild nutty and coffee/cocoa flavours. In the second half more wood and spice prevailed. A excellent 30 min mild/medium smoke. I will be buying more.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Sports Largos
review_text: A very good cigar with pleasant taste and very cheap price.I love it.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Sports Largos
review_text: 30 minutes smoke... Quite enjoyable,very good draw,just went off on the last third, constant flavour.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Sports Largos
review_text: Bought a single at the local shop. A nice 30 min smoke. Typical Cuban and in R&J style. Straight forward and pleasant floral hint. Lots of cigar for the money. Yesterday i went back and bought a box from 09. I+ll have another one today, walking the dog.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Sports Largos
review_text:
Very nice cigar, medium, typical RyJ style....foral, herbs and hints of woody flavors, very complex.

Machine made until 2002, after 2002: handmade.

title: Por Larranaga  Montecarlos
review_text: I love these because I can't always afford Montecristo Especial's.  These are straightforward, but have tons of smoke and burn great.  They smoke for over an hour and are a little dry, which brings out more of the London style flavors that the true Isle's savant loves.  The flavor are nutty and creamy, with a nice tobacco earthiness.  The price is amazing and well worth it.

title: Por Larranaga  Montecarlos
review_text: I bought a box of these on a bit of a whim in Andorra. I am a huge fan of the picadores and also the French regional edition (I forget the name) So I thought for 75 euro - what the hell! I am glad I picked them up. At first I couldn't help but feel the size and shape a little redundant. First 5-10 mins are very light. But as I got into it, it developed well. Although this is never going to be particularly complex, it is silky smooth. Crisp burn and draw is great. Right down to the end. Its not going to rock your world or deliver a knock out punch but it is a very pleasing way to spend 35 minutes. I think I will keep these for the rare occasion I smoke in the morning. It would be great with a coffee mid morning. Well worth a try. Long panatelas and lanceros are often passed over and I hope they do not go extinct as fatter ring gauges are obsessed over these days.

title: Por Larranaga  Montecarlos
review_text: Beautiful and mild cigar, very mild I think and too tight. A cheap habano and no my favorite but you can smoke one of this in the morning. Three months in my humi is not enoug, maybe you need a year or two.

title: Por Larranaga  Montecarlos
review_text: i bought o box of 25.my first one , two days in the humidor was verry good.i really lie this cigar and i think it will be excellent with age.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Wide Churchills
review_text: easily my most favourite cigar on the market, a real medium bodied cigar. They always seem to burn perfectly and last about an hour to an hour and a quarter. unfortunately I only have 1 left :(

title: Romeo y Julieta  Wide Churchills
review_text:
This is a very smooth, mild cigar. 

Good construction and pretty good burn.

Turned very spicy in the last 15 minutes.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Wide Churchills
review_text:
This cigar has consistently been a 7-8 for me and were I interested in spending more of my disposable income this would be my regular smoke. When it first came out it was wonderful. I would have given it an 8 and left it at that. Over the past year or so the quality of the build has gone down a bit and I get a less even burn. I smoke hot (fast) and I find that I am regularly burning my fingers on these since I smoke them right to the end and they don't build up a strong bitterness like some other brands.

A lot of folks have commented on the size and that has to be a part of the allure for these cigars for me. I tend to prefer a larger ring on my cigars and this one seems to hit the mark.

These are your staple R&J with their typical flavour profile. If you like R&J, you will like these. If you prefer something spicier, these will never rate above a 7. 

I read some of the other reviews and they mention letting them age. If you have the patience you should give that a try and see how you feel about it.

One thing I can say - open the box before you buy. I always look for a nice, oily shine. Something a little dark. Those ones seem to be the best from my experience with these (I've probably only smoked about 50-60 of these cigars though so some people will likely have a broader experience) I have a box on hand that I will try and age for a year and see what that does - of course, I will have to try one now, for science and all that.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Wide Churchills
review_text:
From a sampler, so no box date. 

This is definitely one of the coolest looking cigars I've seen. Perfect color, short and fat. Very cool double bands. 

Great pre-light aroma. The first few puffs were reminiscent of my first dime store cigars -- very pure tobacco taste. Throughout the smoke everything was lightly aromatic, very smooth and refined. Unfortunately the draw was quite tight, and the underwhelming amount of smoke led to an ashy flavor. 

I don't know if this cigar would benefit from more age. I had high hopes for this one, but it didn't hit the mark unfortunately. Of course not a bad cigar, but it doesn't resemble the praise I've seen for it. Hopefully this is just batch variation.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Wide Churchills
review_text: I've had 3 of these and they've all been great. Not too strong as I'm new to cigars but a good medium body all the way along. Great construction and burn never had to relight, a good hours smoke for me. Thoroughly enjoyable!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: perhaps the strongest cigar i have ever smoked...very tasty...i like em.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: First one I've ever smoked & what a gem! Beautiful smooth wrapper, perfect draw, even burn & so much spice I was smacking my lips while smoking it. Too bas these are no longer made.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: This is the very first cigar that offered to me and smoked many years ago,this is the cigar that when i first smoke it i felt the floral,woody and persistant peppery piquant spice in my mouth and nose,not at all aggressive but enough to wonder suprisingly 'oh my God is this how cigars taste?'.That is the reason that i will give this tres petit a top mark as this little stick was my initiation to Cuban cigars and finally this cigar will always have a place in my humidor.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: From a box dated May 2005. Full taste without being overpowering, not acidic at all.  Very enjoyable cigar that can easily be smoked over a couple of hours if you aren't a quick smoker.  Draw on this particular one was a bit tight to the point that the last third was very difficult to keep lit, even accounting for my slow pace.

title: Punch  Tres Petits Coronas
review_text: Enjoyable short smoke. Has a very subtle chocolate taste to it. My only complaint would be that it burned somewhat unevenly.

title: Punch  Tres Petits Coronas
review_text: Very nice, strong aroma. The smoke really hits you but not in an unpleasent way.

title: Punch  Tres Petits Coronas
review_text: Finished the box dated 1998. Good quality indeed! Difficult to find however...

title: Punch  Tres Petits Coronas
review_text: These are lovely but not as good as IMO as the tubed Petit Coronations which are only 1/4" longer. The difference is an extremely fine line though.  I'd be inclined to buy whichever was cheaper, unless having them in tubes (or not) is particularly important to you.

title: Bolivar  Supremas Churchill
review_text: Best Bolivar I've tried so far. Nice draw and burn, loaded with flavous of coffee and sweet wood. Has a pleasantly long finish.

title: Partagas  Toppers
review_text: proof that machine made cigars can age with fantastic results .

title: Partagas  Toppers
review_text: Tried one of the previous reviewer's. I don't mind machine made cigars at all.. at least you know they're not gonna be plugged! This one offered some spicy Partagas flavours, decent aroma. Enjoyable experience. If they were as cheap as Bolivr says, then definitely worth a purchase.

title: Partagas  Toppers
review_text: Found these as a remainder stock and not expensive at all. Lovely smooth Partagas tobacco which makes these an unusual rare treat

title: Partagas  Toppers
review_text: Unusual vitola, decent smoke. Satisfying strength, basic Partagas aromas, but not enough aroma for my liking. The tobacco leaves a cheapish impression. Somewhat lacking in character. At that price, I'd rather have a young Mille Fleurs. (LOC NOV 00)

title: Partagas  Toppers
review_text: This cigar was a fantastic new one to me! Boughth 2 boxes, I think the last ones LOG MAR 01. Very well aged, dark notes of earth, first third  nice Partagas peppers, then more and more down to to the rainy forest, some hints of saddle . The last third was very awesome, if you dont like tarry and spicy tastes, keep, please off! Not masterpieces to look on, but what a hell OLD CUBAN PROFILE I found! Please, roll Them in future, too.

title: Partagas  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: Good little petite smoke.  Complex enough to be interesting, but also stable enough to relax and enjoy in the short burn time. Excellent draw and well made.

title: Partagas  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: Got 4 from a buddy. Smoked one and was surprised at the unique flavours. A nice change of pace from the Shorts. I think it had more complexity than a short but had less in your face Partagas flavour. This could possibly be due to the age of these guys though. A very good stick and glad I have a few left to smoke later.

title: Partagas  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: Very pleasant surprise. A nice earthy, medium bodied smoke. More substance then the recent version of Shorts I've had.

title: Partagas  Tres Petit Coronas
review_text: What a nice find! Never had these before. Perfect draw & construction. Nice earthy & leathery flavors & stronger than the Shorts. Excellent little cigar.

title: Bolivar  Simones
review_text: Theses have been a wonderful cigar, sadly I have been regularly grabbing them over the past two years. I bought a 5er to try them at release and followed up with the 50 cab and a 25 TEB Oct 08. I find no great difference between the two and still have a few of each left. I also have enjoyed that they seem to me to be true to the Boli profile as mentioned by my friend cookj1.

title: Bolivar  Simones
review_text: TEB-10/08. This is a great cigar full of rich tobacco, leather,and a sweet peppery spice with a chocolate flaavor at the end.

title: Bolivar  Simones
review_text: I had argued for a while that these were one of the best Regionals put out by Habanos, but I smoked one three weeks ago and it seems to be slipping into a sick period.  These exhibit all the best Bolivar flavours and the format is perfect.  They got this cigar just right.  I will look forward to these in a few years, but for the time being I will keep my fingers off them.

title: Bolivar  Short Robusto
review_text: woody, earthy and little bit of grassy taste..but the hold is not  weak,construction is a bit rough..but i do like this size, very good when during afternoon smoke..

title: Bolivar  Short Robusto
review_text: I found this stick to be very strong and very oily. A pepper bomb far too powerful to enjoy down to the nub. Definitely not my favourite Bolivar.

title: Bolivar  Short Robusto
review_text: I found this stick to be very strong and very oily. A pepper bomb far too powerful to enjoy down to the nub. Definitely not my favourite Bolivar.

title: Bolivar  Short Robusto
review_text: These are not Short "Robustos" they are actually called Short "Bolivars" The few that I have tried are very good. I would say mild to medium, peppery and creamy, in the first half. The size gives it a smooth silky texture, and and a really nice medium to full final 1/3. 5 years in the humidor have really balanced out the flavors. Highly recommended if you can still find them.

title: Bolivar  Royal Coronas
review_text:
I am a relatively new cigar smoker only really started in the last year or so.  Prior to that enjoyed cigars but only once or twice a year.  
That said, very good cigar.  Perfect size and gauge for me.  Brilliant first 3rd.  Chocolate undertones.  Lots of smoke.  Slightly uneven burn which settled down in the first third.  Firm ash.  Smoked well throughout.  Peppery taste in final third but never unpleasant.  Smoked down to the final inch.  Will buy some more.

title: Bolivar  Royal Coronas
review_text:
I am a relatively new cigar smoker only really started in the last year or so.  Prior to that enjoyed cigars but only once or twice a year.  
That said, very good cigar.  Perfect size and gauge for me.  Brilliant first 3rd.  Chocolate undertones.  Lots of smoke.  Slightly uneven burn which settled down in the first third.  Firm ash.  Smoked well throughout.  Peppery taste in final third but never unpleasant.  Smoked down to the final inch.  Will buy some more.

title: Bolivar  Royal Coronas
review_text: These are the best robusto's on the market, IMHO.  I have been through three boxes from 2012 and all were oily, perfect burning, and full of moderately strong, typical Bolivar flavors, peppery, creamy, and spicy coffee.  They are not as dark or strong as the belicosto's, and for me, that is a good thing because the Robusto's are so smooth, expecially after a good meal.

title: Bolivar  Royal Coronas
review_text: These are in my top 3 of "Sunday afternoon cigars". The first and second thirds are so much relaxing, very smooth. The final third have a little more character but always with that subtlety. The look is beautiful (a subtel box-pressed one with a nice wrapper), the feel is nice and silky and the draw is very open (no effort needed). At the end, you have a smart and harmonious cigar.

title: Bolivar  Royal Coronas
review_text: very tasty and certainly lives up to the hype.imho it is a 8.8 very unique taste. i will definetly be smoking a few more of these . not a powerhouse like the Partagas D4 but a very fine vitola. Dont be shy . ENJOY.

title: Bolivar  Prince Charles
review_text: one of the best cigars ever smoked! its a favourite. 100/100

title: Bolivar  Regentes
review_text: Found a nice aged half-box of these mellowing in the humidor room of a city centre cigar store, still at a long-ago price ... These no-longer-made Cubans, same size as the Bolivar No 3 Placeras but without the tubes, aged very beautifully, with a rich but soft flavour (tho catalogued in the 'strongest' of the 5 Habanos flavour categories) ... Were beautifully made & all have so far smoked with an easy draw ... delightful

title: Bolivar  Regentes
review_text: Classic Bolivar earth flavor in a small package.  Unfortunately I do not believe they are manufactured any longer, but if you have any appreciation for small cigars, this is great.  It's qualities may be lost on those who enjoy larger ring gauge and length.

title: Bolivar  Regentes
review_text: I just picked up a '98 box, and they are little 25 minute beauties, when they draw correctly. There are a few tight sticks in the box. They are strong with plenty of body; concentrated Bolivar goodness.

title: Bolivar  Regentes
review_text: This is a good little smoke that is spicy and easy to smoke! It will definantly benefit from 6 months to a year in the humidor. As they are right now the get a bit harsh after the first third. More in a few months.

title: Bolivar  Petit Belicosos
review_text: Currently my favourite, get them if you can!

title: Bolivar  Petit Belicosos
review_text: Excellent cigar. Burned evenly, and such a smooth smoke. Rich and spicy cocoa with toasted hazelnuts. Full bodied and a welcome punch of flavours. Goes extremely well with port or a good rum.

title: Bolivar  Petit Belicosos
review_text: Just a great cigar, pure chocolate and rich smoke.  A pleasure to smoke and never boring.  I love it.

title: Bolivar  Petit Belicosos
review_text: Smoked two Petit Belicosos in the past couple of Days in Dubai while sitting outdoors, enjoying the near perfect weather conditions currently in the Emirates. I must say that I found the cigar pretty underwhelming given the great reviews it has harnessed so far. Compared to many other Bolivar releases, this one seems to have somewhat missed the boat. While there are hints of greatness at the beginning, the cigar flatlined soon after. The Bolivar Oryx Qatar RE 2011 as well as the regular production Belicosos Finos are much more rewarding choices for hardcore Bolivar fans as well as regular aficionados. After five years of ageing, this cigar is only going downhill from now on. No boxes for me.

title: Bolivar  Petit Belicosos
review_text: Bolivar Petit Belicosos LE 2009-Aug-09- excellent cigar, balanced and complex with predominant sweet cacao and spice notes, gains strength towards the middle, I place it as medium-towards-full body, by no means overpowering. Its earthiness is more subtle that other bolivars. Excellent smoke draw but some have uneven burn.

title: Bolivar  Palmas
review_text: good

title: Bolivar  Petit Coronas
review_text: Box is May 15. I have been bitterly disappointed with this box. The consistency has been appalling. Bought a 25 box and have about 15 left. 5 of those 15 that are left are unsmokeable. They are rock hard and totally plugged. I've cut them but I can hardly pull a molecule of air through them. I'll have to buy one of those tools to unplug them. If you get a good one then great. Otherwise forget it. Typical Cuban quality control. I think I just got a box full of lemons.

title: Bolivar  Petit Coronas
review_text: Not sure about this one. Single at least 3 years old. Consistent earthy flavour with coffee and some sweet notes appearing half way, after which it deteriorated. A bit disappointing.

title: Bolivar  Petit Coronas
review_text: Delicious! very complex and rich. Nice strong cigar.Spicy,full bodied.Must in humidor.

title: Bolivar  Petit Coronas
review_text: I bought this box because I enjoyed an aged box of Bonitas over a period of four years or so and wanted to replace it. Unlit aromas typical of the marca: orange and milk chocolate. While this cigar packs a flavor wallop, there is no harshness. Enjoyable at 18 months but needs more time to reach its potential.

title: Bolivar  Legendarios
review_text: Really good cigar, everythings are ok. Pure taste. http://img10.imageshack.us/img10/3232/resim1135.jpg

title: Bolivar  Inmensas
review_text: A true classic cuban, not a morning cigar, not suitable for beginners, only to recomend after a rich meal,  an XO rum fits perfectly. Excellent value for money. It beats the 06 Cohiba V easily.

title: Bolivar  Inmensas
review_text: After countless Dahlia I came to a conclusion: this is the best

title: Bolivar  Inmensas
review_text: I had two singles and both were outstanding - perfect for a lazy afternoon!Subtle, very well balanced herbal and floral aromas, just the right companion for a cold beer. An absolute recommendation!

title: Bolivar  Inmensas
review_text: Again, I can not say enough about the Inmemsias. This is an old school-hardcore taste of Havana. I have enjoyed them since I began smoking and were turned onto them buy a pilot friend. She was smoking too, and also smoked this cigar. Tastes of leather, good coffee with spice and good old fashioned long leaf Cuban goodness. Enjoy these as they are no longer produced.

title: Bolivar  Lonsdales
review_text: Agree with everything reviewer #22 said. Not as refined as the Gold Medal but old school Habanos flavor which I love. Deceptively powerful with beautiful Cuban earthiness, it's a wonderful example of why Cuba excels at smaller ring gauge cigars.

title: Bolivar  Lonsdales
review_text: I'm about half way through a box from 1999. These were discontinued in 2002. They are strong, bold, and slap you in the face with earth and leather. In contrast to some of the other reviews, I don't notice the creamy smoothness of the Gold Medals. Mine are rough and rustic and are a great choice when I want an old school Habanos after a great meal. A great cigar experience.

title: Bolivar  Lonsdales
review_text: Typical Bolivar. Coffee, creamy taste. Rich aroma. Mild to medium. Godd constuction, burn.

title: Bolivar  Lonsdales
review_text: A real shame that this cigar has been discontinued. I remember them as being slightly milder than most other Bolis. Smooth and creamy. Cocoa. Never harsh.

title: Bolivar  Fabulosos
review_text: I purchased box 71/2600 during a trip to Amsterdam and decided now was the time to fire one up. Excellent shape, firmness and prelight aroma. Holy Cow! First third was leather, hay and an obscene amount of white smoke!  The cigar then developed hazelnuts, earth, and burned sugar until the band...just getting progressively stronger and more flavorful. Excellent burn and taste that had a wonderful finish. I would compare it to the Beheke but with a touch more power and flavor..it was that good. A gorgeous hour long smoke that I am pleased to award top marks.

title: Bolivar  Libertadores
review_text: Not a bad cigar, but seriously, it does not belong at the top of the list... Has potential, but lacks depth and complexity. Nothing like the other top cigars... 2.5 stars.

title: Bolivar  Libertadores
review_text: Great cigar which lingers on the palate and memory. Truly deserved to be a regular production LCDH edition after the success of the regional release. Creamy, cedar, coffee and sweet shortbread. Outstanding at just over a year of age... A few years should make these perfect tens

title: Bolivar  Libertadores
review_text: Thank God Habanos SA released this regional as an LCDH edition.  It's a fantastic bargain for such a good cigar.  This is one of the best LCDH releases.  A smooth but full-bodied cigar.  These are perfectly rolled and the draw is excellent.  You get those strong Bolivar flavours, but not too strong as it's a big cigar.  I have two boxes aging and I'm looking forward to seeing what age will bring out of these excellent cigars.

title: Bolivar  Libertadores
review_text: Such a fantastic cigar! It has a great flavor profile through the entire smoke. Draw was smooth and consistent. A new favorite of mine!

title: Bolivar  Greco
review_text: Subtle and complex. Not a true Bolivar profile, which takes away from the enjoyment (and the score...) I hope they do not loose all their flavor over the next few years... Better smoke them now. 3.5 stars

title: Bolivar  Greco
review_text: nothing special about this cigar... not bad but not great

title: Bolivar  Greco
review_text: I bought a box from Athens on May 2010 only ten pieces have now in my hum..Nice cigar.Very smooth.Not strong like others BOL.medium body but complex.

title: Bolivar  Greco
review_text: This is a very good cigar yet not as full bodied as I was hoping it would be. Bought a box from the Dubai international airport nevertheless.

title: Bolivar  Greco
review_text: Without a doubt, one of the best cigars ever.  Not your over the top Bolivar flavours.  This is complex and balanced.  Absolutely the best Regional I have ever had.

title: Bolivar  Especiales No 2
review_text:
Still quite strong yet smooth...little change throughout...what was there was intense flavourful and all bolivar.

yes a once in a lifetime chance to smoke my utmost fantasy cigar.

title: Bolivar  Especiales No 2
review_text:
NOTE:  THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE RE-ISSUED GERMAN REGIONAL EDITION, NOT THE ORIGINAL.
I hope no one minds...  These REs are absolutely AMAZING smokes.  I have enjoyed 2 samples so far, and they are some of the BEST smokes I have ever had in my 10 yrs smoking cigars regularly...  Sweet, fruity, earthy, toasty, spicy...  The list goes on & on.  The amazing complexities of these smokes show themselves best when smoked SLOOOWWLLY, so as not to overheat the leaves & release bitter flavors (as with ALL lanceros/panatelas).  Do yourself a favor, make some friends in Germany before they run out!  I wish they were a bit cheaper though, (around $25-30US/stick) but you fully get what you pay for with these.  Unsure of box dates, since I only could afford some singles & a sampler box with 2 of these & 2 of the 5ta Avenida...  I will purchase a cabinet (of 25) as SOON as I can though!  Perfect construction, easy draw with huge pillows of creamy smoke, flavors as noted above, elegant appearance, with no veinage & a flawless wrapper leaf on all my examples so far (about 7)...  Truly a celebratory smoke, as this one will NOT let you down when that special occasion is upon you!  Plus, REs are RARE, adding to that 'special-ness"...

title: Bolivar  Especiales No 2
review_text: Smoked a sample dated mid to late 80's. An exceptionally savoury smoke. It amazed me with a glutamine (Umami) spice and dry earthiness - absolutely no sweetness. A once in a lifetime experience - but to console most of you: Smoking one of these readily available '99 Coronas Extras today will give you a very rough idea of how these might have tasted.

title: Bolivar  Gold Medal
review_text: Excellent full bodied cigar.Plenty of aromas.Even burning lots of smoke

title: Bolivar  Gold Medal
review_text: Got two more boxes from LCDH-Luxembourg- Nov/09. Nice dark wrapper. Firmly rolled for a perfect draw. Very rich with earthy, peppery aroma and flavors. Perfect burn with flavors and characteristics unlike any other cigar in my collection. Responsibly priced too !

title: Bolivar  Gold Medal
review_text: Just finishing the last one from a box of 10. Firm construction but ample draw I think these have 1-2 years age cant remember box code. These are some of the fullest bodied smokes I can remember for a long time. I taste and smell typical good Bolivar flavours but much more intense. A good 1 hour long puff, sharp clean burn nice ash - recommended - but not for the uninitiated!

title: Bolivar  Gold Medal
review_text: Excellent cigar, good draw and burn from start to finish.  A full bodied earthy smoke with lots of smooth creamy rich cocoa and caramel flavours.  A must have in the humi.

title: Bolivar  Gold Medal
review_text: Great cigar with loads of billowing smoke. cigar burns evenly every-time. Produces a white ash that does not want to fall off. This is one of my favourite go to cigars. creamy, rich and full bodied right to the last half inch.  Factory code on the box MAU  from August 2009.

title: Bolivar  Emiratos
review_text: Tried them at LCDH JBR in Dubai last month. Was not impressed at all given the hype this cigar got in the region. The draw and construction were quite good. But the cigar was one dimensional and didn't offer much complexity.

title: Bolivar  Emiratos
review_text: I was in Dubai last week and picked up one these from Casa Habanos. The lady at the Casa name Liz talked me into trying one. I must say this is really a fine cigar. Very even burn not as full bodied for a Bolivar but a truly fine cigar. The Emiratos reminded me of the Monte Sublime 2008. Called Liz today and ordered her last two boxes.

title: Bolivar  Distinguidos
review_text: On Jan. 2nd, 2015, I smoked one as a gift from my Taiwanese cigar buddy Magic Frog. This stick has been kept in my humidor for couple of years already. It still has a sheen on the wrapper and appears quite oily. The draw was smooth and the flavor was strong from the start. The intensity picked up and it was hard for me to put it down. I also noticed the Regional Exclusivo band was gold embossed, rather than the standard silver embossed. This is definitely a collector's item. Whether you are investing in rare Cuban cigars or a lover of Habanos, this will be a must have for you. This is made for long term aging and a purchase you will not regret.

title: Bolivar  Demi Tasse
review_text: Submitted by Alex  on March 6, 2005

title: Bolivar  Coronas Gigantes
review_text: Very Disappointed! Based on the reviews here, figured it would be a great stick, earthy, leathery, tasty for the first 2/3, but nothing special compared to the Beliscos Finos, which are much better cigars, this box has a year and a half on it, letting them hibernate, and seeing what they do. Box dated May 15

title: Bolivar  Coronas Gigantes
review_text: I recently got a cabinet of 50 cigars from 2008.  What a beautiful cigar, construction was flawless. Wow, what a powerful cigar.  Rich earth flavors with slight wood after taste.  I had to put it down half way through and rest a bit.  Last half was just as good as the first.  I can't believe I got 49 more to go.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Gigantes
review_text: A sublime cigar with honey notes, rich earth and near perfect combustion. I have smoked these on many occasions and they never seem to disappoint. First third is mild, as most Bolivars tend to be, with nougat, dabs of honey and mild earth tones. Second third has the earthiness develop into wood and the final third bears no resemblance to the first, with heavy smoke and full rich tobacco. Enjoyable and satisfying.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Gigantes
review_text: Perhaps my favorite Bolivar when not too tightly rolled. When right, as good as any of its size. Strong, full-flavored with obvious flavor shifts throughout.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Gigantes
review_text: Bought a box several years ago... first few were poorly and too tightly rolled yielding a terrible acrid burn. I had so much hope for this cigar based on other reviews, however, after trying one more from the same box after a 12 month rest, still the same horrible experience. Will continue to smoke my other Bolis but this box needs to be put to rest.

title: Bolivar  Churchills
review_text: I bought a few years ago the rest at a local dealer. The dark wrapper. Construction OK, sometimes pull tight. Started medium, last part is full. Nice aroma and taste.

title: Bolivar  Churchills
review_text: It's rare that a Churchill delivers body and full flavor from beginning to end.  But that is the case with the tubed Churchill I had from Bolivar.  First, a great presentation--the tube itself it really nice and old school.  The cigar itself is big and well rolled.  The flavors are classic Bolivar and with 10 years of age now, that classic Bolivar flavor is outstanding.  Never overly strong but always rich and delicious.  If you're lucky enough to find one--grab it.  I haven't seen one for sale in years.  A true 10.

title: Bolivar  Churchills
review_text:
Lovely looking Churchill that came in an aluminium tube. Came at a bargain price as the local LCdH was having a stock clearance last year. Being superceeded by the Corona Gigantes, having quite some age and slight layer of powery white substance, I finally lit it today with much anticipation after sitting in the humidor for about half a year.

However I was sorely disappointed. The cigar had a case of chronic uneven burn. It was poorly constructed, loosely filled and kept going out. Despite my best efforts to rectify this, I ended up wasting about 3 quarters by which time the smoke became overly leathery and tannic. I probably got about ten memorable puffs out of the whole length.

That aside, it did show flashes of brilliance when it did decide to behave. Sweet toasty milk coffee, very flavourful. I hope the box of Corona Gigantes I got recently will be better constructed.

Sadly this is the sole stick and I will be unable to revisit what I believe would have been a brilliant experience. All things considering, I believe a 4/10 score would be fitting and maybe even generous, only because of those few brief interludes I managed to eke out of it.

title: Bolivar  Churchills
review_text: i had a Bolivar Churchills in a tube, and i was lucky that the cigar was a bit oily when i took off the label ... the woody/earthy flavour of the cigar is one of the best,.. Bolivar dark leafs always provide a great aroma and taste to its smoker...

title: Bolivar  Churchills
review_text: Just finished one of these that has been in the humidor for about a year and that has been time well spent - started off quite mild and very smooth perfect for a summer evening the middle third then became quite spicy in comparison, but not unpleasent and finally it finished off with a little woody taste, an excellent smoke.

title: Bolivar  Coronas
review_text: Got a box from 2000 at LCDH and all I can say is that they are absolutely great.15 years old and they are still superb.I say still,because some others loose much of their flavors after long aging.Not this Bolivar though !!!!!

title: Bolivar  Coronas
review_text: what a great cigar...sublime balance...fu hsa for cutting this cigar.

title: Bolivar  Coronas
review_text: I bought mine from a dealer nearby, must have been a very well aged one! The taste was brilliantly balanced - smooth spicy and fresh Bolivar aroma. What a hit!

title: Bolivar  Coronas
review_text: Second stick of an aged three pack I managed to get, this time to savour on its own without drink. As per my review #19, the flavours are more discernible with some herbaceous notes at the start. Not as full bodied smoke as anticipated but still full of flavour with a strong kick to it. Burns dead even yielding a dense white ash.

title: Bolivar  Coronas
review_text: New to cigars and this is a great smoke. Mellow and tasty, thick creamy smoke with a definate flavour. My palette is not that experienced for flowery description, but i enjoyed it immensley, muuc more than the punch petit coronas earlier today. Get some in.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Junior
review_text: An excellent cigar, one of the best I ever tried, full of flavours, full of personality with the true Bolivar taste as the others reviewed it.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Junior
review_text: This was a 10 for me.  Amazing creamy bold flavors of coffee, cedar, hay, and some sweet cocoa.  Perfect burn.  An amazing hour in my cigar career.  Best part is, they have aged so that they really are a morning, noon, or night time cigar.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Junior
review_text: These minutos smoke great young. Blast of hay and cedar in the first third. Then it morphs into a charred oak/cedar, and an almost raisen fruity flavor. Lots of sweet cedar on the retro. Last third is strong, chocolate and coffee, with spice, cedar still hangs on.A little tannic at the end, but hey its only 6 months old. These are even better at two years old. Very long oily finish. This is what a Cuban is all about in this format

title: Bolivar  Coronas Junior
review_text:
reviewer no. 41 - I agree completely
you wont go wrong with these...

title: Bolivar  Coronas Junior
review_text: Great little cigar that packs a great deal of flavor into such a smalll format. Was never a huge minuto fan until recently - love them now - Monte # 5, Partagas short, RASCC, etc.... rather have a pair of these than a Robusto

title: Bolivar  Coronas Extras
review_text:
Was a little concerned about this box due to all the issues that occurred at the end of the 90's (construction issues, poor quality).
Those concerns were put to rest once I opened the box and inspected the 25 beauties inside.  They taste and smoke even better than they look.  Perfect draw, razor sharp burn. Loads of cocoa,mint, cinnamon and leather w/ vanilla undertones.  An absolutely stellar smoke.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Extras
review_text: TEB MAR07 - Everything about the Corona Gigantes is condensed, intensified, with dialed up ligero content. It is a superb example of a bright (top spectrum) Bolivar when aged correctly.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Extras
review_text: Excellent !!!!

title: Bolivar  Coronas Extras
review_text: I bought a box of 50 a couple of years ago after having smoked a couple 25,s boxes.Woderful Bolivar never had a bad one and one of my top 10 smokes.

title: Bolivar  Coronas Extras
review_text: Beautiful cigar. Great gauge and length for an easy and consistent draw start to finish. Strong, full-bodied flavours but smooth finish. These are great for a special occasion or for a quiet evening and a drink. And the price is fantastic. Love these!

title: Bolivar  Colosales
review_text:
I've smoked eleven cigars from this cab since I bought it in 2006. Has changed very little in the eleven years I've had them. On first light the typical Bolivar strength comes through and not much else. These cigars possess a distracting tannic quality that unfortunately never relents for the entire length of the smoke experience. the underlying dark espresso, leather, and earth qualities I usually get from Bolivar are there only subtlety as the smoothness is completely overwhelmed by the aforementioned tannin character. Very frustrating as I want to love these cigars.
Additionally I've had to pitch another four sticks from this box because they were absolute dowels.
Cigars were purchased at a LCdH in Europe and have been maintained in my walk-in at 65/65 so I'm of the belief that I just got a rotten cab.

title: Bolivar  Bonitas
review_text:
Got the last 2 boxes from LCDH from 2004 !!!!
Great little cigars and one of my favorite Bolivars.Shame they are gone :-(

title: Bolivar  Bonitas
review_text: Very good cigar, classic bolivar flavor, perfect taste, medium to full body.

title: Bolivar  Bonitas
review_text: Bolivar is my all time favourite and these Bonitas are no exception. Smooth and rich with a sweet light taste. Ends spicy and smooth. A wonderful cigar with an easy pull. No surprises, not as full as the BRC or Corona Extra yet a leisurely relaxing smoke.

title: Bolivar  Bonitas
review_text: Small velvet cigar with good construction, is firm. Lighter at the beginning, later increased strength. Pleasant smell and good taste Bolivar.Milder then PC, more like a small Lonsdale.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 3
review_text: This was my first time smoking the bolivar tubes No.3 and indeed my first bolivar upon observing this small cigar you are greeted with a medium-dark wrapper with a oily texture with a beautiful construction, faultless. The scents are of cocoa and slight chocolate. upon lighting i found that the draw was incredibly tight and struggled to pull a mouthful of smoke from it and the flavours are rather disappointed there is a lot of spice throughout the mouth and a slight harsh feel on the back  of the throat in first third there is a slight creamy taste which fought with the harshness in the second third this disappeared but reappeared briefly at the point of blending between the second and the final third before disappearing again there is also a slight earthy taste throughout the smoke. all in all the flavour isn't particularly complex and is not the greatest and i must agree with a previous reviewer that said it is much alike to a henry winterman half corona which is much cheaper. The burn was good staying level throughout the first two thirds but  spoilt attrociously  in the final  third. The combustion wasn't great either i had to relight it twice with a total burn time of an hour. To summarise this small cigar has a full body and was faultless prior to lighting, it packs a punch for its size but is rather let down by its flavour profile, draw and combustion, however i would try it again incase this was a  bad example its potential.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 3
review_text: Beauty little cigar... Earthiness and sweet, aromatic medium flavor, some coffee, cedar and chocolate are present in this habano. I recommend smoke it in the morning.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 3
review_text:
I'm enjoying my Bolivar No.3 this morning as I drink a warm cup of tea in the garden and I'm incredibly taken aback by how much punch this wee stick packs. I was recommended this in my local shop after explaining to the assistant that my usual smoke is Jose L Piedra Nacionales and that I wanted something a little stronger because, as an ex-cigarette smoker, I tend to inhale my cigars out of habit and maybe needed something stronger.
 I was surprised to read some egative reviews on this as it seems like a great little number. Unlit, I picked up on ots dark tones, very harsh to the nose. Lighting it up, however, I realised it held much more than just strength. Immediately I was hit by a variety of flavours. Admittedly, I'm still relatively new to cigar smoking but my tongue knows what it knows and there is no way the sweet coffee and mild peppery flavours can be ignored. Every mouthful of smoke was different and well balanced, I was kept interested to the finish. Drawbacks I would mention would be that it did require relighting twice, this could be due to the smaller ring size than I am accustomed to, and that it burned quickly, but well. And, still, I inhaled a few times, without choking; something heavier may be required next time.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 3
review_text:
I'm enjoying my Bolivar No.3 this morning as I drink a warm cup of tea in the garden and I'm incredibly taken aback by how much punch this wee stick packs. I was recommended this in my local shop after explaining to the assistant that my usual smoke is Jose L Piedra Nacionales and that I wanted something a little stronger because, as an ex-cigarette smoker, I tend to inhale my cigars out of habit and maybe needed something stronger.
 I was surprised to read some egative reviews on this as it seems like a great little number. Unlit, I picked up on ots dark tones, very harsh to the nose. Lighting it up, however, I realised it held much more than just strength. Immediately I was hit by a variety of flavours. Admittedly, I'm still relatively new to cigar smoking but my tongue knows what it knows and there is no way the sweet coffee and mild peppery flavours can be ignored. Every mouthful of smoke was different and well balanced, I was kept interested to the finish. Drawbacks I would mention would be that it did require relighting twice, this could be due to the smaller ring size than I am accustomed to, and that it burned quickly, but well. And, still, I inhaled a few times, without choking; something heavier may be required next time.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 2
review_text: According to me, close to perfection! The only thing I have to say more than that is that I wish it lasted longer

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 2
review_text: I recently bought a box dated 1997! The vendor told me they might gotten too old and reduced the price... indeed they are old but so nothing else than well aged. Trying them I felt the way Zino might have felt, when he got his "overaged" box of unbranded cigars from a local farmer on one of his first cuba tips. The first third I experienced the maximum possible amount of aromas such as cocoa and leather. Second third was spectacular with a stronger earthy presence and hints of vanilla. While the last third got little too much on the strong side, nothing infringed the integrity of the solid ash. Truly magnificent but not the cigar, rather its history.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 2
review_text: Maybe one of the best marevas i have had. Little tight on draw at start but the aroma of fresh from tube eased that. Halfway through it really started to kick in heavy complex floral flavours with cocoa undertones. Beautiful wrapper, well constructed, and even burn made this one of the great cigars. Was very pleased!

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 2
review_text: I wasn't too impressed with the flavor from the Tubo No. 2. The construction and draw were great but this smoke had a weird creamy taste to it that I didn't appreciate too much. My full review here: http://wp.me/pSZbU-qE

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 2
review_text: Very much enjoyed this cigar, great taste. Although did have have a little of an uneven burn.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 1
review_text: 2015 box; This is an excellent Corona, and sadly HSA announced its discontinuation in 2017. Earthy, woody and slightly spicy--very Bolivar. Excellent burn and construction. Room to improve but a solid 92 point cigar right now. Pick these up while you still can.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 1
review_text: Wonderful fruit and chocolate flavour, ages incredibly well, the older the better. A beautiful dark wrapper with perfect draw, lasts about one hour.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 1
review_text: I bought it in Iran. It was not to bad. Nice Bolivar flavours here. Nice spice, leather. Medium to full cigar.

title: Bolivar  Bolivar tubos No. 1
review_text: I did'nt expect much from this cigar cause i nerver heard about it .My girlfriend brought these back from Cuba as a gift.At first i found the smell great.Wath a nice surprise when i lite it WOW wath a good cigar,chocalate sweetness was very present all the way trough .Strong cigar with medium to full body.Only thing i didnt like about it was the color of the tube ,will buy more

title: Bolivar  Belicosos Finos
review_text: April 15. Young and delicious. I can't figure out how can I age some boxes. Discipline? Sure. I just can't figure out how can I have discipline.

title: Bolivar  Belicosos Finos
review_text: Only detraction was a wonky burn for the first half.  A quick retouch and it stayed perfect all the way to the nub.  Roasted peanuts, leather, creamy cedar, roasted coffee, sweet dark fruit like stewed cherries, and an aged musty quality.  The retro on this cigar is divine.

title: Bolivar  Belicosos Finos
review_text: This is an amazing cigar. For around 2 years, it was my favourite. Massive flavours, along with a huge power. Perfect to go along with cognacs or other similar beveradges.

title: Bolivar  Belicosos Finos
review_text: Just bought a cabinet JAN 15. Young cigar with outsanding power and flavour. The burn was fairly even, but not perfect. Smooth and power perfectly balanced. These cigars are improving box after box, each being better than the previous one.

title: Bolivar  Belicosos Finos
review_text: Amazing cigar! Great when young, wonderful with age as well, but an all around fantastic smoke! Tastes of cream, honey, leather, coffee, nuts (I taste both macadamia and cashew), wood, and deep rich tobacco! Pairs well with coffee, sparkling water, tea, anything! Have smoked a fresh box, it was amazing, and have aged for ten years, slightly different flavor, but just as good, maybe even a little better!

title: Bolivar  Armonias
review_text: At $120 a piece this must have been quite a smoke. Anyone any feedback?

title: Bolivar  Belvederes
review_text: Disgustingly good.  I was given three of them from Abel, the manager at Partagas, from his private collection last week.  They were not wrapped in cello.  Abundant smoke.  Full flavour.  Incredible balance.  Smoked it until my fingers burned.  Too bad they are discontinued.

title: Bolivar  Belvederes
review_text: Smoked one of these from the 80's recently. The cello was yellow but it stilled smell pungent and smoked like a mouthful of dirt--I mean that in a good way--very powerful twenty  years on.  Unfortunately I very, very rarely see this cigar anywhere.

title: Bolivar  Belvederes
review_text: Good for a quick smoke only... not the best "cheap" cuban cigar out there...rolled tightly... suggest cutting 1/2 inch off each end to make it a 4" shorty.  The cigar starts of extremely blandish in flavor,very boring.. but does pick up quite a bit by the finish... weak wrapper - a "semi-decent" quickie smoke, but lacking in drawing and taste qualities... I've had worse...

title: Belinda  Princess
review_text: Same code JM OCSC. Really not bat small stick.Medium strenght. Fruity flavour and taste,smooth.Nice quick smoke.

title: Belinda  Princess
review_text:
JM OCSC .
Amazing little smoke , a real gem .All these years in the cellophane transformed that cigar into something special.Smooth,mild and tasteful with fruity flavors .

title: Belinda  Petit Princess
review_text: Cigar from box JM OCSC are now 10 years old.Maturing make good progress in taste.Cigars are medium to full in strenght.Subtle earthy,tobacco taste,pepper.Harsch in tehe end.Averange constuction.Not bad for 15 min.

title: Belinda  Petit Coronas
review_text: Have a box from 97. Ten years does wonders to any smoke I guess. Not a complex smoke at all, just good solid flavor. Never any draw problems.

title: Belinda  Demi Tasse
review_text: Its combination of tobacco with blended with mild herbal flavours is good.

title: Belinda  Coronas
review_text: They are not terrible.  Cheap price most likely.  They taste a little of barn yard to me, if you can, spend a few more bucks and get something a little higher rated on here.

title: Belinda  Coronas
review_text: A very inexpensive cigar. I enjoy a light smoke and these fit the bill. In the past 6 yrs I've smoked about 7-8 boxes when I can get them in Cuba. Now available in Canada I keep a stock for guests They seem to enjoy them as well.

title: Belinda  Coronas
review_text: Rubbish cigar.  Not representative of a good Cuban cigar.  Slightly better than a Guantanamera but not by much.  Some may think that the tube elevates the cigar, but it's not even a tin tube.  I have a box of these that I bought at the same time as a box of Troyas and they will be saved to hand out to people who don't know cigars.

title: Belinda  Coronas
review_text: used to smoke these in cuba,they were surprisingly nice for the money,wish id have got more of them now.a nice smoke.

title: Belinda  Coronas
review_text:
Plastic tube. First when i opened and saw the wrapper i thought nothing but bad about it.
First when lighting, draw was tight. After 20  puffs the cigar loosened up and was nice to smoke. Quite decent smoke for the money. Burning was bad, but relighting did the job finally. Amazing was that the ash stayed for half of the cigar length.
[IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/2j3gpzb.jpg[/IMG]

title: Cohiba  Torpedos
review_text: Purchased two within this last twelve months as singles. They come in a nice Cohiba torpedo tube. The first one was a generic Cohiba. The 2nd got squishy halfway through. I found the second experience most unusual as I have never had this experience before with Cohibas. I have never been a big Cohiba fan after smoking almost every other brand out there.

title: Cohiba  Torpedos
review_text: Enjoyed one last night, and it was a very nice smoke, Taste of nuts and leather abounded, the ash was strong and it smoked very easily and lasted for over an hour. A very good torpedo. This and the Monte #2 piramide shaped cigars are my favourites of this style.

title: Cohiba  Sublimes LE 2004
review_text: The best of the best,great cigar.Problem many were false, i bought a box in Bahamas and they were false.One of the best from Cohiba wish I could get a box now from any auction.Price is no problem.

title: Cohiba  Sublimes LE 2004
review_text: Buian, my friend actually I bought last month a 25 cigars box - sublimes, for 220 $ with an original humidor ( as they said) they smell and taste amazing, so I think nowadays it is hard to figure out the authentic from the fake, if u enjoyed it so they are not fake

title: Cohiba  Sublimes LE 2004
review_text:
Hi,

Can some tell me if this are a 04 fake?

http://imgur.com/a/Ksrj8

10x,

Ronen

title: Cohiba  Sublimes LE 2004
review_text:
(Important Notice: The stick I will be reviewing comes from a bunch of 25 sticks that I purchased after the recommendation of a friend from an non-official retailer. The price for the bunch was 800 US$ and I made all the possible tests that I could imagine in order to verify if they are the authentic ones or not - bands, long filler leaves, smell, color, etc. Still, I am not 100% convinced that they are authentic, they could indeed be of cuban origin, but not from within the factory. Most likely I will never know for sure.)

The cigar was very well constructed and with a perfect burn and medium draw, not to tight and not to easy. Intense throughout, even though the first kick, when lightning up, gave way to a more round and subtle earthly tone of flavors. The ash was light grey and kept hanging on to the cigar for quite some time. Two full hours of smoking this Sublime and the variations on the nose and on the flavor palate where not that great. I missed the creamy Cohiba notes and the evolving spice that I know are some of the characteristics of the brand.

In conclusion, I should say this: This was my first and last purchase from an non-authorised dealer. These Sublimes will remain in my humidor for the years to come, in order to determine if there is any evolution in the aroma and flavor. Even if they are indeed the authentic Sublimes and not just a very good counterfeit, I will always remain with the doubt in my mind. And that alone could very well be worth the extra 1.500 US$ to by them from an authorized dealer, if you can find them.

title: Cohiba  Sublimes LE 2004
review_text: good

title: Cohiba  Siglo IV
review_text: My second Siglo IV was much smoother than the previous one. Amazing flavour and very complex taste with medium strenght; pairs great with a 40 years old tawny Port wine.

title: Cohiba  Siglo IV
review_text: Full Cohiba taste, stronger than the Siglo VI. Gives a 70 minutes smoke, without any loss of character. Not properly complex yet, though - needs some aging time to refine. An 8,5 for this lovely looking Corona Gorda.

title: Cohiba  Siglo IV
review_text: Amazing cigar. Paired this cigar with a whisky and all I could think was how smooth they both were. A very creamy smoke that was mild at the start and worked its way up to a medium strength. After experiencing this cigar I will have to make it on of my main stays.

title: Cohiba  Siglo IV
review_text: Not much.

title: Cohiba  Siglo IV
review_text: From my perspective as a new beginner, this kind of cigar is the reason why I got interested in cigars. I got assosiations to eating cotton candy at a circus, white flowers and greek honey. This cigar was a really great and creamy journey. It has similarities to my other favourite from cohiba, namly esplendidos.

title: Belinda  Belvederes
review_text: Not perfect cigar but his price very good!

title: Belinda  Belvederes
review_text: Belinda Belvederes from a dress box stamped EOG SEP 00. For less than two bucks each, a fine value and a good smoke. I like this little perfecto when I'm driving the car or walking the dog. Its strong tobacco flavor requires no particular concentration to enjoy. Not as pretty as higher priced cigars and offers an occasional uneven burn, but overall a dependable smoke for the money.

title: Belinda  Belvederes
review_text: the '89 examples of these smokes are quite nice...tasty and insane strength...i like em.

title: Cohiba  Siglo V
review_text: i have smoked some of the finest and the Siglo 5 is one of those .

title: Cohiba  Siglo V
review_text: just finished my first Siglo 5 .1hr40mins ofpure pleasure so flavorful;super rich mocha flavors right throughout the whole smoke. hard to explain how enjoyable it was. a friend of mine gave me 3 of these and told me they were 3 years old and to just enjoy. i will be sure to thank him. i thought the Bolivar bellicosa fino was fantastic but the siglo was in another leaque altogether very pricet but if you want to experience one of the best ; dont miss this.

title: Cohiba  Siglo V
review_text: Just enjoyed a beautiful example of this cigar.Very smooth with a hint of spice and wood notes. The wrapper was a very nice dark brown with no blemishes. The draw was smooth with ample volumes of smoke. A very enjoyable cigar.

title: Cohiba  Siglo V
review_text: Even in its infancy this is my favorite dalia. Rich Cohiba flavors, even burn and most importantly for this vitola, a good draw.

title: Cohiba  Siglo V
review_text: Best cigar I have ever had !!! Smoked one for breakfast and it last for 1 hr 40 min. Sensational wrapper, easy to light, even burn. Full of flavor with a velvety mocha creaminess the whole way through. Good solid ash with first fall at 35 min. Will be buying a lot more of these sticks. 10/10.

title: Cohiba  Siglo III
review_text: The flavor profile of this cigar was rather unimpressive.  Thoughout the smoke, there was no noticing everyone change in taste.  I thought the entire smoke was rather bland.  I would not purchase these again.

title: Cohiba  Siglo III
review_text: Good but overpriced cigar. Bean flavours and soft asian spices combined with milk chocolate and mocca make this quite a complex smoking experience. It's a mild cigar. I enjoyed it, but in my opinion it somehow lacks backbone and may become a little bit tiring. Quality of construction was okay, but nothing too special. 3 out of 5 cigars had a slightly uneven burn.

title: Cohiba  Siglo III
review_text:
Got a few singles on special offer at LCDH at the price of siglo 1.Happy about the price,but I'm not sure I like it more than the siglo 1.
Still,a very nice cigar.Smooth,well constructed (although draw was a bit tight)excellent burn and tasty.

title: Cohiba  Siglo III
review_text: This is a good cigar, the contruction is OK, draw and burn as well. Silky colorado claro wrapper. It is a medium strength cigar. Since the second half are being considered strength and depth, smooth.

title: Cohiba  Siglo VI
review_text:
I smoked the first one out of the box about a week ago and was very surprised at how good it was. I think the creaminess of it stood out the most. Put it this way, I enjoyed it from the time ai lit it right up until I put the nub out over an hour later.
With that said, I lit the 2nd one in the box and was pretty disappointed. It still had the same lovely flavours but ai noticed it the wrapper came apart slightly in a couple of places. Surely you could say the stick hasn't been humidified properly, but the first showed ZERO signs of being dry while the 2nd sat in a perfect humidor for the week.
Inconsistency? 
I hope the 3rd is as good as the first!

title: Cohiba  Siglo VI
review_text: The Cohiba Siglo VI is the riches and creamiest smoke I've had the pleasure of smoking. It is my favorite by far.

title: Cohiba  Siglo VI
review_text: This is a cigar that performs the exact way I expected it to. The Cohiba flavours are very good in the limits of perfection and age gives them class. Lovely cigar - should be 8,5, but since no such grade is available here, it will be a 9 (also because I foresee more intensity in flavours in a near future).

title: Cohiba  Siglo VI
review_text: A truly magnificent cigar! This was a Sep '15 production and it's unbelievable how good it's been for such a young cigar.Creamy,nutty with a subtle coffee bean base.And the smoke is silky smooth and velvety from the first light to its finger burning nub! A wonderful finish that's still going now 20 minutes later.The absolute epitome of what a fine cigar should be and how it should make you feel.I am so mellowed out right now!! I'm going to try hard to leave them alone now until they're a year old but it won't be easy! Masterful!

title: Cohiba  Siglo VI
review_text: Smoked on a balmy 35 degree 70% humidity night in Bangkok. This cigar delivered the most creamy chocolate coffee molasses smoke that I've ever experienced from a cigar. It was an epic 90 minutes of smoking pleasure. It will be hard to top this one.

title: Cohiba  Siglo I
review_text: 2015 box date. Draw on this particular one was tight. Took almost an hour to smoke, although I do dmoke slow anyway. Hay for first third. Turned into coco and toasted tobacco for the rest of the cigar. 88 points.

title: Cohiba  Siglo I
review_text: Nothing wrong with this cigar but also nothing spectacular.Add the poor value for money to the above and that is the reason why I no longer buy them.At that price I can enjoy RASS or Bolibar RC's.For me, 6/10

title: Cohiba  Siglo I
review_text: A comfort cigar for me when people get me down. True tobaco all the way no suprices just good smoke! Would like it to be 1-2 cm longer, butt even 18 eur. price wount putt me down. EXELENT CIGAR

title: Cohiba  Siglo I
review_text: Yes,it is indeed a nice cigar for I ever tried Siglo 1 experience only... its 38ring size and 102mm short length make it a pricy and unjustified smoke comparing to Romeo & Julieta Short Churchill,a very nice Robusto....as such it had refrained me from making it a regular smoke...perhaps if manufacturer were to consider to increase its length to 129mm? :)

title: Cohiba  Siglo I
review_text: Normally, i like robusto size, especially cohiba robustos. I believe that siglo 1 is really wonderful. when i smoke this, never miss cohiba robusto. It is short but satisfactory. Also, it can be preferred in short coffee breaks. I highly recommend to all, you should get in your humidor absolutely.

title: Cohiba  Siglo II
review_text: NOV 15 box date. This box has really been a mixed bag. They are without a doubt one of my favourite cigars but I've had a number of duds recently. 5 or 6 of the box have had serious burn issues, either in need of constant touch ups or relights. When they are good they are really good. When they are bad they are hopeless and its frustrating. I guess that's the same old story for most Cubans. If they would just sort out their quality control issues...

title: Cohiba  Siglo II
review_text: Very mixed feelings on this cigar. Tried two from a 3 sample and they were superb. Had another two from a 5 sample box and they were dull and tasteless. Guess i was unlucky with the last ones...

title: Cohiba  Siglo II
review_text: A nice cigar with light brown wrapper.Burning well,slowly, draw OK. Rich creamy flavour, mild to medium in strenght. Little expensive.

title: Cohiba  Siglo II
review_text: Have smoked a number of cigars over time and i keep coming back to the siglo no 2 as my all time favorite every day smoke. I smoke slowly, as i feel the cooler smoke allows a wider palate of flavours...my avg smoke time is 1 hr. Which is perfect given the time i can spare. Flavours are not very complex but definitely consistent throughout the smoke. Being a HUGE fan of sweet flavours I find the creamy, sweet cedar, nutty and toasty nuances to be heaven. Medium amounts of smoke. It was definitely a young cigar as the tannins were evident on the retrohale. Thinking about buying a box to age but afraid i wont be able to make it last over a year.

title: Cohiba  Siglo II
review_text: Not sure this is the most accurate score, since I had to puff this baby in two interrupted segments (approx 1/2 each time). Even considering the re-light conditions, I feel this had far too little distinctive flavor and far too much of a charcoal effect. Second half was a better tobacco kick, which saved the smoke, but for a lower priced Cohiba (if there is such a thing), I would go with the Secreto 5 Maduro.

title: Cohiba  Secretos
review_text: If you got one of these and it was underfilled, i'd say it very likely wasnt real.  These are tightly rolled little flavor bombs.  Very consistent tight draw and longest burning Reyes you can get.  This is a cigar where you dont start to respect everything it offers until you smoke 5-10. Its a dense but cool smoke - blue smoke comes from this one fills the room with a special aroma.  Rich and complex from start to finish.  First one or two may seem one dimensional.  This one requires a more advanced palette to appreciate.

title: Cohiba  Secretos
review_text: Box date: SEP 15. Not very generous on the pre-light aroma. This is a good old-fashioned maduro profile with plenty of brown sugar, coffee and steak on the grill. As with every Cohiba I've smoked, the construction is impeccable (no touch-ups) and the buzz is nice and relaxing. Not a top cigar (yet) but well worth the price of admission.

title: Cohiba  Secretos
review_text: What a disapointment, i was looking forward to smoke it so I got a box and I didn't like it. Very expensive, underfilled, good taste and burn but with some draw and constrution problems. I don't recomend it.

title: Cohiba  Secretos
review_text:
My first cigar ever then it's my everyday cigar.
I really enjoy it with my coffee, a rich and strong flavor of spicy chocolate tobacco. I recommend it.

title: Partagas  Super Partagas
review_text: I've enjoyed 6 or 8 boxes of these, they are a good smoke for the money.  One of my daily choices.  Plenty of flavor and strength, and I don't feel guilty if I whack it in half in order to enjoy a short 20 min. break.  All mine have been the hand-made variety.

title: Partagas  Super Partagas
review_text: One of my go to cigars when I`m not looking for any particular stick. Never had any problems with these. Though I`ve only smoked couple of boxes from 2012-2013. Great price-quality ratio. Obviously there are better cigars but not in this price range.

title: Partagas  Super Partagas
review_text: A bad cigar. The blend is unimpressive, and almost every other cigar in the box I got was plugged. Stay away.

title: Partagas  Super Partagas
review_text: Since mid 2002, this cigar is offered in a Hand Made format. :-D

title: Partagas  Super Partagas
review_text: june 2011 good box - most had great construction and draw. loads of flavour and much better than the Partagas corona seniors i bought at the same time - and even a little less in price. Box pressed and although young smoked and burnt nicely.

title: Cohiba  Robustos
review_text: This review is based on multiple cohiba robustos that I have smoked. Net net my favourite cigar. The robusto format delivers the best mix of ring gauge, mouth feel and smoking time. Grassy, nutty, honey sweetness with hints of toasted bread and short bread. Each third delivers a distinct transition in flavours that never bores. The finish is medium to long that lingers a while after, on the palate. Construction is perfect 9 times out of 10. And the aroma in the room is always a smokey sweet haze that reminds you of the classic cigar you just experienced. In short ... Perfection. Well worth the premium price tag this vitola retails at. Though I keep a number of cigars in my rotation I keep coming back to this classic again and again.

title: Partagas  Shorts
review_text: Not sure why it says a 15 minute smoke.  I easily got 50 mins out of mine.  Anyways, amazing body for the size.  Rich notes of chocolate, baking spice, honey to start.  Built in body and created a nice pepper zing halfway.  Incredible value.

title: Partagas  Shorts
review_text: Reminds me of its big brother D4, minus the huge cedar blasts. This is a fantastic minuto. Medium/Full bodied experience. 1st 3rd. Blast of Party pepper right out of the gate with a little cedar. Then the cream and honey hit the palate as the pepper resides a bit.2nd 3rd. Coffee and cocoa, cream is still around, pepper comes in on the retrohale.Last 3rd Is almost identical to the 2nd 3rd, but the partagas spice kicks in as this stick finishes strong. This starts medium and finishes full. This rating is high, just like my Bolivar CJ review. I base my reviews on price point/flavor/and how the cigar represents the marca.For under 5 bucks I rate it a 9

title: Partagas  Shorts
review_text: Good smell, strong flavor, and easy to carry. Also very good to maintain in a humidor, don't need too much care.

title: Partagas  Shorts
review_text: This one is an excelent minuto cigar. Almost every cigar of this vitola provides a good smoke, as the ramon allones small coronas club, or Bolivar petit corona. You can have a real partagas experience even if you are short of money or time. Is a quick smoke and affordable smoke, with a lot of personality.  Will last 30-40 min. The present flavors are wood and creaminess, with the signature peppery partagas  tobacco.

title: Partagas  Shorts
review_text: A tasty fellow for almost every occasion. I liked it more than the 8-9-8 as it was more pronounced from the beginning. For the size and girth it does give just the right pleasure. Not too much, not too little. Leaving some desire for more...

title: Cohiba  Robustos
review_text: what a pleasure.just a fantastic smoke. did not want to let it go.

title: Cohiba  Robustos
review_text: Meh, bought a box of 5 at LCDH in cuba a year ago, smoked four of them, all of them pretty tasteless. Good construction and draw, however not very flavourful.

title: Cohiba  Robustos
review_text: This came in a tube, purchased from cigarone in Switzerland so no box code.  Let's first say the cigar looks superb, a little firm and the band is magnificent.  Amazing that its not just the cigars but also the Cuban bands that are vastly superior (almost never garish) to their counterparts.  Upon lighting I realized both that it was quality tobacco, but also (to me) slightly too loud.  Very strong, too strong too soon and perhaps a little raw. If I happened upon a box, I would let it age for a year or two.  Less immediately complex than a good D4 for example.  As I keep puffing, its gets slightly stronger but not a lot of flavour development. For a go to smoke for the connaisseur I would venture to say that this is as disappointing as it is expensive. (78 out of 100), still excellent tobacco, just too young and/or not my blend.

title: Cohiba  Robustos
review_text: This is not good as much as Siglo 6 for me, but must be awesome cigar. Perfect construction, very smooth draw, burn and feels like a bitter dark chocolate, cream, cinnamon tastes. I'll be try it again!

title: Partagas  Serie P No 2
review_text: Superb cigar.  Guessing at box dates but I have purchased many boxes all are really excellent.  I age them at least 3 years.  Rich tobacco with cappuccino, cream and spice.

title: Partagas  Serie P No 2
review_text: Just superb after 3 years, with rich satisfying flavours which develop as other reviewers have noted, but nothing special when younger, so be patient!

title: Partagas  Serie P No 2
review_text:
Along the lines of the d4 only slightly milder when aged tobacco honey spice and raisins.
Almost always excellent construction.
Current box is thirty months and just continues to please like all other boxes of these.

Give them two years plus

title: Partagas  Serie P No 2
review_text: Earthiness, leathery and salty. A classic habano flavor but its medium body is not better than a Serie D No. 4. There is no a biiiiiig special thing in this cigar.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 2
review_text: One of the best cigars to come out of Cuba. Such balance and flavours.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 2
review_text: Superb parejo - perfect draw, burn, and fantastic spice flafors through a Partagas toasty base core - wonderful example of thiner Partagas with full flavor - what a cigar - deserves 100 stars

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 2
review_text: I just enjoyed another Series du Conn #2 and thought I'd throw another superb rating towards this often-overlooked gem.  As mentioned, the thinner ring-gauge cigars really pack some flavors and this is no exception.  Along with its longer brother--the Number 1, this is one of the finest cigars available.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 2
review_text: Had one last night and the draw was overly tight but it was still smokeable - just. It took perhaps twice as long because of this but I wasn't in a hurry. Worth the effort as the flavour was just sublime - all of the classic Partagas profile minus the spice/pepper/mint of some of the stronger ones (perhaps the hard draw prevented the hot burning that accentuates these characteristics). Smooth, light-medium bodied, rich, sweet, consistent, satisfying. This was a single I got out of curiosity - I'd love a box of these if i could be guaranteed an open draw.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No. 3
review_text:
Construction was excellent, with a smooth, mat wrapper, very oily to the touch. Draw presented some resistance. Perfect for this size of cigar. Pre-light aroma was a little grassy, with some chocolaty hints. 1st third - immediately gave off a blast of pepper to the nose. Flavour was a little chocolaty but a little vegetal and thin at the same time. Distinct feeling of smoking a chilli pepper.
2nd third - pepper present but beginning to subside. Quite sweet, still chocolaty tones. Medium-full body. 3rd third - Pepper is now gone, leaving the vegetal taste, with a lot of spice. Really reminds me of a chilli pepper. Not overly complex. Body is now medium. Burn - 8/10. Overall, I'd give the cigar a 87/100. Great for Sunday afternoon. Prefer the Connie 1

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No. 3
review_text: Wow, a seriously under-rated stick! Perfect construction and draw. First few draws were of sweet creamy caramel which settled into the typical Party peppery spice gradually becoming deeper and denser until the end. What a wonderful smoke!

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No. 3
review_text: For those who sometimes like thin format, these are quite elegant and I believe to be a far better option than say Cohiba Panatellas.  They are not however in my opinion exactly like the Partagas range in taste.  They are indeed a bit more spicy but not quite as forward.  They smoke extremely well and slightly slower than most other thin gauge.  I find these to be a great warmup cigar for a friday night before the second larger format kicks in on the second bottle of red.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No. 3
review_text: The Connie No. 3 is a very unusual flavour profile for Partagas, in my opinion.  It's extremely floral, aroma-wise and flavour wise.  Strong marigold.  This is offset by strong cedar notes and I'm not sure that this balances the cigar.  I ended up enjoying the cigar for its differences but I'm not so sure this is a classic Habanos.  It's a very elegant cigar and I enjoyed it this morning with a nice cup of coffee.  Perfect burn and draw.  This cigar did not lack for smoke.  I will smoke other 8-9-8's before coming back to the Connaisseur No. 3.  A nice change, however.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 1
review_text: I smoked one from my 1999 box...just an exceptional cigar from start to finish. Honey, caramel, sandalwood in rapid succession. Never harsh or bitter with an impeccable burn. What a classic with nice port in hand.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 1
review_text: I was fortunate enough to get a cabinet of 25 from 1997. Fabulous cigar from start to finish. Even though they were almost 16 years old they still retained that Partagas spice and white pepper taste along with a smooth sweet creaminess. like all cigars the more moist and humid the cigar the less flavor you get I found that this cigar really comes to life if dry boxed (ie take out the humidor a day before you smoke if they are very soft)

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 1
review_text: Amazing cigar is not the description one is looking for, astounding is more like it - with true old Partagas flavors of toast and spice - simply brilliant.

title: Partagas  Serie du Connaisseur No 1
review_text: ive smoked 3 out of the box of 25. superior construction, nice dark wrapper- almost glistens from the oil on the wrapper.
