Curiously the strenght decreases towards the end. My conclusion is that this cigar is a great value for its very low price, a bargain if you need something to smoke for half an hour.

title: Partagas  Parisianos
review_text: From a box of '98's, currently available. A real bargain for a vintage cigar! Very pleasant mild-medium strength Partagas machine-made, with all harshness aged out. Smoke is almost creamy in texture. Draw slowly to avoid overheating, as with all short filler cigars, and you will not be disappointed. Perfect after a weekday dinner, or on a weekend afternoon; satisfying but not too demanding of time or attention. I ordered two more boxes.

title: Partagas  Palmas Grandes
review_text: found 3 boxes, 2 complete and 1 already started. Great; 2 to collect, and 1 to smoke :-). They are getting used to their new enviroment, after 40 years of dedicated aging. I'll try one this weekend!

title: Partagas  Partagas de Partagas No. 1
review_text: Wonderful full body cigar after 13 years.Excellent draw and burning.A lot of rich smoke full of spices.

title: Partagas  Partagas de Partagas No. 1
review_text: Wonderful cigar,the wrapper on mine are quite dark btw.

title: Partagas  Partagas de Partagas No. 1
review_text: A Classic Partagas - simply delicious. Buttery toast on earth base, with alluring spice. Brilliant Partagas of old!

title: Partagas  Partagas de Partagas No. 1
review_text:
I really like Partagas and it took a lot of willpower not to smoke through this box! I tested a stick every New Years Eve! To be honest I am looking forward to the end of this month. They are ready 
Hints of leather, cocoa, a bit of sweetness and spice, makes for one dynamite cigar! 
While it looks like the wrapper never darkened I'm sure it must have, just not to the maddy darkness! On mine at least!
This box was well worth the wait, I wouldn't mind picking up a few more 06's (last year) and holding them for a few decades.. 
How unfortunate this is a discontinue! Probally to make way for the obese Cuban of late!

title: Partagas  Partagas de Partagas No. 1
review_text: I found this to be too mild with not much complexity and depth of flavour. There was a typical Partagas flavour profile, but it just wasn't coming through.

title: Partagas  Perfectos
review_text: Still it is found in Spain. I buy recently 3 boxes from two different stores in the north of Spain. only 2 euros per cigar!!.  They have matured in an excellent way. they have draw problems but...  Strong flavor woods and creamy.  A true pleasure.

title: Partagas  Perfectos
review_text: Still it is found in Spain. I buy recently 3 boxes from two different stores in the north of Spain. only 2 euros per cigar!!.  They have matured in an excellent way. they have draw problems but...  Strong flavor woods and creamy.  A true pleasure.

title: Partagas  Partagas De Luxe
review_text: This is one of my favorite cigars, its the most balanced tabacco taste I have ever come across. The burn of the cigar is not the best, but I don't mind at all.

title: Partagas  Partagas De Luxe
review_text: Not a bad smoke. I was suprised that this Partagas  was so pleasant, but it reassured me further in the quality of tubed cigars. Flavors are that of leather, earth, bit of spice and some coffee notes, something like the D4, but on a lesser scale. Construction was very good and the strenght was solid medium. Smoking time was around 1 hour and 15 minutes. Price for this Partagas de luxe tubos was 9 USD per piece. Taking everything into consideration, this cigar is a solid performer.

title: Partagas  Partagas De Luxe
review_text: Cheap everyday option, strong flavors for a small cigar. Earthy, pepper and cocoa notes. Used to be better, look out for the older black and gold label

title: Partagas  Partagas De Luxe
review_text: Totalmente a mano!? Tube is yellow whith some red "stripes" same golored as the coronas senior the tube is just little longer. Great suprise for me i like it more then the senior and this is all so longer. Taste is smooth and a little bitt milder then senior. Bought the tubes 4 weeks ago and smoked 6 every one hav been great in aperance, burn and taste.

title: Partagas  Mille Fleurs
review_text: MAY 15 Code PMU.  Lots of bloom on many of the sticks.  Bought this box as an alternative to my usual bargain Super Partagas.  Smooth but fuerte. I was so impressed I got another 3 boxes and I'll try to put back a couple of those.  Great value for the money, this is an every day kinda smoke for me.

title: Partagas  Mille Fleurs
review_text: Code factory PUO. I tried about 10 pieces from several boxes. Some pieces look ugly with green spots on wrapper. The contruction is good, draw and burn is OK. Some are tight rolled. Medium taste, good flavour.Not as good as 8-9-8 ( from 2008), but still very good. After 4-5 years will be most better, I leave the remaining boxes to age. A nice Partagas cigar   7,5/10.

title: Partagas  Mille Fleurs
review_text: Elegant and moderate musk/leather/dark chocolate, not the itense flavour of Partagas we are used to but nice and smooth.

title: Partagas  Mille Fleurs
review_text: Solid smoke. You get the Partagas body/flavour in a good value price. Burn inconsistent. But good value.

title: Partagas  Mille Fleurs
review_text: Great cigar, good taste and no draw problems at all. Very good the quality/price ratio. Full bodied in perfect Partagas style.

title: Partagas  Londres Finos
review_text: No cello.  A very enjoyable 45 minute smoke.

title: Partagas  Londres Finos
review_text: This cigar had golden cello tint.Rich prelight aroma.After lit woody taste for a few puff,then earthy taste with peppery tones,sometimes coffee beans tones.Full boddied old school.Little harsh toward the end.Very enjoyable cigar.

title: Partagas  Londres Extra
review_text: smoke a few from a 98 box and it is dynamic. It is full of strenght and typical of old Partagas. It is a bit harsh toward the last third, can't imagine the impact when you smoke it young. Overall a value for money short smoke and it is better than an age Partagas Short, eventhought is is machine rolled. Burn was even and the color of the wrapper was really dark.

title: Partagas  Lusitanias
review_text: Very good cigar, very good burn. Don't wait for spicy, quite mild. For me, perfect for a Sunday afternoon reading.

title: Partagas  Lusitanias
review_text: (MOB Coded) The best DC hands down. Leather, earth, roasted peanuts, and chocolate are dominant. Velvety smoke. This cigar never disappoints. Dark and oily wrapper. One of my favorite Havanas, a stand out in the Partagas portfolio.

title: Partagas  Lusitanias
review_text: Brilliant Cigar - My favourite Cuban, I just ordered another box !

title: Partagas  Lusitanias
review_text: This is the best cigar I have ever smoked. Got it on a trade so I didnt get a box code. So complex it was unreal. 2 hours 15 minutes of pure Party pleasure. Draw, construction, and p burn were perfect. Outstanding cigar

title: Partagas  Lonsdales
review_text: Ifind this lonsdales very tasty. Rich earthy flavor, perfect burn. Complex and rouded. I can described cigar like medium bodied.Not so strengt as i expected.

title: Partagas  Lonsdales
review_text: Another from the same cab as previously reviewed. Superb! Fullbodied rich earthy flavor, perfect burn & draw, and the slowest smoking lonsdale I ever had. I puff pretty regularly & this wonderful smoke still lasted over 90 minutes.

title: Partagas  Lonsdales
review_text: yea, another bonehead move by HSA discontinuing this cigar.  This latest example I put to flame was soooo easy to smoke- very creamy with bright leather and fruit flavors.  medium bodied and full flavored.  about 1/2 way through body picked up to medium full and flavors were more on the peppery spicy side while still maintaining the cream and fruit.  great cigar.  perfect construction, burn, and draw on this example.  Like bassman said you HAVE to get these in cabs

title: Partagas  Lonsdales
review_text: One of my all time favorites. Rich earthy flavor. Why did they stop making these? From a cabinet of course. Dress box versions are just not the same.

title: Partagas  Habaneros
review_text: Yeap,very nice cigar,beautiful taste and burn!!! Worth it.!!

title: Partagas  Habaneros
review_text: I want to buy 1 pack. some one pls tell me is it similar to super partagas.  because I have 20c super partagas left n I want somethin diffrent

title: Partagas  Habaneros
review_text: Tried a well aged one from Habanos store in Tehran (Iran). Very enjoyable, earthy and not that peppery, sweet with notes of cocoa, coffee and very creamy. Short smoke perhaps but very well worth the try.

title: Partagas  Habaneros
review_text: The price for a box of 25 is between 80 and 100 $ it depends the contry and in canada its more than 100 $

title: Partagas  Habaneros
review_text:
I have no reniew. I want to order Partagas Habanbra shorts and want to know prices of
3, 10, 25 and how packaged, please.

title: Partagas  Culebras
review_text: After keeping one coffin for 2 years in the humidor i decided to smoke this interesting culebra on the night between the years.The draw was very easy and smooth but the taste was not special.Good taste but not special.The only interesting thing remains the look of the cigar.

title: Partagas  Culebras
review_text:
IM PROBABLY THE MOST EXPERIENCED CIGAR SMOKER ON THIS WEBSITE- So here is my review. A very unique cigar to say the very least. 

Far from being a complex cigar but very far from being a straight forward cigar. The Culebras is a very enjoyable Cuban cigar. The draw is easy, also did possess typical Partagas flavours but lacking the power of most Partagas cigars that are known today.

As previously mentioned a very unique cigar that would be very enjoyable both to novices and real cigar aficionados like myself.

In summary a thumbs up for me, not outstanding but very far from bad.

title: Partagas  Culebras
review_text: Crazy cigar. But rich and flavoured.One of the best Partagas i have had.No burn problem. Earthy a leathery taste, some peppery, but mild too. I was very Crazy cigar. But rich and flavoured.One of the best Partagas i have had.No burn problem with with it.

title: Partagas  Coronas Grandes
review_text: had the second on the terasse today after a HdM DC ... what a diffrence to the HdM DC  would accept if you offer me the same quantity of Partagas in change of my HdM DC ...Iam so glad that I could get a box of the Partagas Gran Coronas, I will keep them for special occasions

title: Partagas  Coronas Grandes
review_text:
Got one from 2000 , draw was a bit tight
but acceptable. Very nice spicy , herbal aroma little sweetness. The stick gets more and more from all of it the nearer you come to the finish. Never bitter or sharp, burns good. Will buy the whole box today if its still there.

title: Partagas  Coronas Grandes
review_text: Excellent cigar.  Medium bodied cigar.  Burns and draws extremely well.  I smoked this baby right to the end and it still tasted great.

title: Partagas  Coronas Senior
review_text: Nice draw smooth construction but i think you can get better value from this cigar if let them age for a while. The one tasted was average nothing special for a Partagas. Brand has better on this value and compared to Partagas Short is less flavored. Recommended but do not expect much from what this cigar has to offer.

title: Partagas  Coronas Senior
review_text: Hands down one of my favorite everyday go-to Habanos. Don't remember the box date of my recent box (due to moving) but they're about 4 years old now and perfectly creamy und silky, with lots of damp earth, leather, spices and a fragrant pepperiness. Quite complex too, and the construction is top notch (perfect draw, even burn). Highly recommended, much better than R&J Milles Fleurs and 45 minutes of real Partagas flavour.

title: Partagas  Coronas Senior
review_text:
I think this very nice cigar deserves a higher score.It is extremely well made for the price,has all Partagas flavor , excellent burn and high quality tube.
Only reservation is that of a too tight draw sometimes,which even at this good price,Partagas has to be more careful and consistent.Solid 8 from me, but I would give it 8.5 if I could.In fact I believe it is a better cigar than the Mille Fleurs.

title: Partagas  Coronas Senior
review_text: Fast becoming my favourite small cigar. Strong but smooth with some similar floral notes to the Serie D No.4. Good construction and worth paying the little bit extra than others for the quality and complexity. See review #39 for a more elegant description than mine. Think the ring guage is 42, not 44. Wish I could keep them long enough to see how they mature.

title: Partagas  Coronas Senior
review_text: Not a bad cigar but I agree with the previous reviewer, I would go with the "Super Partagas" over this one anytime. The price is almost the same and I had problems with the Corona Senior (wet cigars) on many occasions. The taste is characteristic of Partagas with earthy and spicy tones so in that sense you will not be disappointed. Consistency is the real issue as well as the alternatives in the same brand.

title: Partagas  Coronas
review_text: Thought it offered some good spicy flavours, but overall, the cigar was fairly dull.

title: Partagas  Coronas
review_text: Great smoke. good flavor and aroma. i'm beginning to like these thinner-gauged cigars.

title: Partagas  Coronas
review_text: Smoked one about a week ago. It was a rather strong smoke with a slight spice and leathery taste. Construction was slightly rough, but burned very evenly. I enjoyed this cigar very much. Too bad i onl bought one from the cigar shop when I was there, I will buy more seeing as to how good the cigar was (and the price too).

title: Partagas  Coronas
review_text: Strong, but very very harsh. Maybe in a few more years...

title: Partagas  Coronas Junior
review_text: This cigar did have a very uneven burn and a very rough and unpleasant flavor. There were mosty a sharp and unrefined peppery and leathery flavor. I should say that I have not aged the cigar myself. But I bought it from a serious retailer so I would quess it has some age.

title: Partagas  Coronas Junior
review_text: A consistent smoke, that will burn and draw as intended. The downside is in the flavors department. The partagas signature peppery notes are barely present here, and the flavor profile have little changes during the smoke. For lack of complexity, there are cheaper options. Maybe an outdoors cigar, to smoke while doing smething else, but not a cigar to drown in.

title: Partagas  Coronas Junior
review_text: .... nice cigar. The draw was good, the smoke and ash were good as well, The taste varied from very smooth and light at the beginning, to a little harsh and inconsistent in the middle, finishing very smooth and earthy.

title: Partagas  Coronas Junior
review_text: I find that this cigar gives me a better snoke than Petit Coronas Especiales.

title: Partagas  Coronas Junior
review_text: I was able to coax an hour out of this one. Beautiful Partagas flavor and perfect burn. Not a D4 but similar flavor so it deserves an 8.

title: Partagas  Churchills de Luxe
review_text: Very good cigar. Lots of flavour of cedar and lots of smoke. Burn is even and ash is strong and full with satisfying thud when it falls off.

title: Partagas  Churchills de Luxe
review_text: Excellent cigar 0n my second box now,slightly on the mild side as most churchills are.

title: Partagas  Churchills de Luxe
review_text: Following my previous review, with some more time in the humidor and a couple of sticks later, I am compelled to upgrade the score. More intensity and fragrance of smoke. Increased interplay of flavours, significant complexity, better graduation of spice and more balance. Burns dead even. Timeless, a classic, quintessential.

title: Partagas  Churchills de Luxe
review_text: Second take on this particular stick. Similar to before but this particular example was lacking in spice and vibrancy of flavours from the one previously reviewed. What happened here?

title: Partagas  Churchills de Luxe
review_text: Managed to get a 5-pack selected from a few boxes when one of the local cigar merchant had a clearance. Cannot remember the exact month but the production year was 2001 on all the boxes. The cigar looked a little dry so they went into the humidor about 3 months ago and today I decided to light one up. Selected the worst possible example out of my 5-pack selection: mottled and crackily wrapper with some specks of green but smooth with a light sheen of oil, also onset of mold. Starts off earthy with all manner of aromatic woods, very smooth and rounded flavours. Flavours build up with more wood and some sweet chocolate developing which becomes more coffeeish as you progress. Earthiness intensifies along with spice levels and the vibrant flavours become mellow. Quite strong in terms of nicotine kick and flavours but overall I found it quite balanced and delicious with a lovely lingering aftertaste of spice and wood. The stick is generously filled which made the draw a little tight. This improves if you gently massage the tip a little which increases the opulence of the smoke. Burns even and long, took me nearly a full hour to get to the final third. I must say that the wrapper is very fine almost wafer thin, attesting to the skill of the torcedor. However, it is obviously too thin to qualify it for long term aging. Around the final third, the wrapper virtually disintegrated and flaked off. Proper smoking technic and full attention will be required if you want to fully enjoy this delicate stick but you will definitely enjoy it. A different expression of Partagas.

title: Partagas  Chicos
review_text: If you compare these against the MC an R&J puritos these are by far the best tasting in their category. Strong cuban taste for a quick coffee break, better smoke then a Cohiba Club and more "cigar" for the same prize. Good value and a nice taste of the famous Partagas brand.

title: Partagas  Chicos
review_text: The Partagas Chico, along with the Montecristo puritos and Romeo y Julieta puritos complment there brands a lot better of than most of the bigger vitola's. Smoking time about 20min.

title: Partagas  Chicos
review_text: Perfect for such a small size and such a unusual low (for Cuban) price! I'll continue buy and smoke them.

title: Partagas  Chicos
review_text: These little cigars are gems. Cigarette sized, cello-wrapped perfect for on-the-go or cold-weather smoking. Not easy to come by but I snap them up when I can. Incredible 20-minute Cuban flavor burst. More flavor than 90% of the marquee brands. A bold statement but is truly one of the only cigars left with that strong classic Bolivar/Partagas earthiness present up until the late 90s. Don't know what tobacco they're using for these little guys but they need to use more of it in the rest of the lineup. If you want to reminisce about classic Cuban flavor these will deliver. Certainly not complex but its single dimension is refreshing and direct. Never harsh or tannic. Been smoking them for over a decade and will never stop. HSA needs to step up their game when this is one of the best cigars in their lineup. :(

title: Partagas  Chicos
review_text: I don't usually smoke mini or other machine made cigars. So I didn't like them. For my taste is mutch better Quintero Panatelas which is double the price but double the smoke time and pleasure.

title: Partagas  Charlottes
review_text: Medium in strenght. Very pleasant aroma, spices, wood, leather, little bit tangy and dry. Pity that they are no longer on the market. Perfect for coffee.

title: Partagas  Charlottes
review_text:
an odd size...quite thin yet decent length.
very tasty...spice and cedar and very acidy/tangy.
strength...very strong 5/5...a classic example of a cigar that increases in strength as it ages.
have 4 or 5 boxes stashed...whenever i see them on the shelves i buy.

title: Partagas  Charlottes
review_text: Sadly, there is one less Charlottes in the world after I sent one to its death on Friday.  If this is old school Partagas flavour then I am a big fan.  The flavours, were big, bold, rich, and balanced.  I didn't find any coffee, more leather and wood.  The smoke is abundant, creamy, and spicy.  I can't say anything bad about this cigar.  I wish Partagas still made these.  There is nothing in the current line up that is like this.  Perfect draw yet it burned a little fast for my liking.

title: Partagas  Charlottes
review_text: I had try two pcs from box FRP OSSU.Construction is OK,good draw combustion.The cigar started very mild and goes more powerfull.I can described like medium fllvoured and medium in strengt.Maybe she lost the strengt with years.Smell pleasant, but i smoked it outdoors.Dominant woody and taste of presso,no spicy.Good but not memorable.7,5 stars.I will looking how they will chynged after month.

title: Partagas  Charlottes
review_text: Just opened a box (probably the coolest box ever by the way, 5 layers of 5 in a small dress box)from 1998. I love the vitola, same as Partagas Serie du Conaisseur No. 3. Dark and very oily wrapper, couldn't stop touching it. They taste very much like Serie du Conaisseur No. 3, only a bit stronger, and slightly more of the typical Partagas flavours. Woody sweetness and a wonderful aroma. Not a lot of spice, not even in the finish. Construction and burn is p e r f e c t in every way. A shame they stopped making these in 2002.

title: Partagas  Bonitos Extra Mild
review_text: Very good cigar.

title: Partagas  Belvederes
review_text: mine were from 2000 and now they are gone, which is good so. I  think these sticks are not worth the money. Some were good at the beginn and real stinkers from the second half onwards and with some it was just the other way around but always could only "enjoy"half of them They are discontnued which is good so. I give them 1 point because they were burning.

title: Partagas  Astorias
review_text:
'98 astorias opened at christmas '06.
have smoked 1/2 a box since christmas...swiftly becoming my favorite cigar...these are some of the best i have.very strong and very partagas...no oranges or lawn clippings here just fine fine tobacco.

title: Partagas  Astorias
review_text: realy surprised by the quality of this sigar. lovely taste, good draw, even burn, everything you want to have from a cigar. not that expensive though.

title: Partagas  Astorias
review_text: Just was rotating cigars in my humidor, and these stand out as a real classic, its a shame partagas has discontiunued this vitole,its a real gem. The boxes i have in stock are all from 00 production runs, the wrappers dark chocolate and the aromas of warm cuban cedar abound. When lighting the first real tease to the senses are the flavors of well aged tobacco, drizzle ontop of that fresh espresso beans, and dark swiss chocolat. A true cuban classic if ever there was one. This reminds me of some old Hupmann Corona majors my father has from 1972, they are still in the tubes and aging ever so gracefully

title: Partagas  Astorias
review_text:
What a classic of fine cuban flavors and aromas, i cant understand why no one is reviewing these. The 00 production runs are classic, dark chocolate flawless wrappers, gentle square press, unmistakabe partagas flavors and aromas, strong smooth well aged tobacco is the primary here, with espresso and chocolate very prevelent.
The unique partagas twang is ever so present as the bloom starts on the top layer. they will only get betterfrom here on out, and that is hard to do.
If you can find them snap them up they are a one of a kind Gem.

title: Montecristo  Sublimes LE 2008
review_text: The ultimate smoke. Down to my last three boxes so only comes out for really special occasions. Had one last night with a bottle of Krug 1982. Excellent combination. Sitting on the aft deck of my yacht in the Greek islands, after a great dinner of lobster stew.

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: An absolute dream cigar now. Very flavorful. Lost some of the harshness I experienced about a year ago. One of the best cigars I have ever smoked. Keeps getting better. Unfortunately I only have 3left.

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: this cigar sucks

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: Hey just purchased box on monte2 from la Cssa del Habano wrapper was really light on the outside . Does that matter?

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: Now coasta rican counterfeiters are saying on their site they are located elsewhere. Prime example is SOLO CIGARS and Royal Habanos.com.
reviewer_name: 43: Now coasta rican counterfeiters are saying on their site they are located elsewhere

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: 38: If you got them from Costa Rica you got fakes , especially online deals . Sorry man ! Costa Rica does not have legit dealers . Anybody who ever was there knows that . Big cigar stores stucked up with fake cubans ! - Submitted by marius on October 10, 2008

title: Montecristo  Robustos Millenium
review_text: I bought my Montes 2000 in 2004 and resisted opening the jar until 2007.  My experience with ELs and other aged cigars has been that time does them good.  I was not disappointed.  This was a cigar that was head and shoulders above most others.  I have been smoking for over 20 years and in the last 10, mostly super premium only.  This was the second best cigar ever (all time) for me.  Better than the Cohiba Piramides EL 2006, better than the Siglo VI (and those were incredibly good), better than the Hoyo Piramides El 2003.  The only cigar that I have found as complex, as full of indescribable mix of flavors, was a Cuban Davidoff in the 80's before they broke off with Cuba.  This cigar assaulted all my senses, smell, taste, touch, sight.  It looked great, felt great, smelled great, and tasted of caramel, vanilla, with hints of leather.  It was good at light up and got better and better through to the nub.  Most cigars are good only in the precious second third, not this one.  This one was the real deal, a 9.7-9.8  I have smoked ten up to now and they are all consistently great.  I don't give it a perfect 10 because I have to leave room for the Monte Sublime EL 2008 that everyone is raving about.  I will be getting those next month when I travel to Spain.  Reviews should be limited to your insight into the cigar, limit argument over fakes, etc.  If it looks bad, smells bad and smokes bad, it's a fake.  All Cuban cigars that I have smoked in the last five years are good to great.  The worst (of the major brands) is merely good.  I recently smoked a San Cristobal Muralla and it blew me away.  Didn't expect much and got a wonderful smoke out of it. The only lousy cigars being made in Cuba today are the machine made short filler cigars such as Guantanamera, the handmade long filler cigars are all good.

title: Montecristo  Sublimes LE 2008
review_text: Still my number 1 of all time. Saved only for the most special of occasions! I have 2 singles left (saving for myself :D ) and a complete mint condition box of 10! Starting to consider selling on the box of 10 if anybody is interested. Based in London, viewings welcome etc.. contact me nimahashemi@btconnect.com

title: Montecristo  Sublimes LE 2008
review_text: Very Very Good !!!

title: Montecristo  Sublimes LE 2008
review_text: Just opened up another box.  The beauty of the cigar is matched by the taste and enjoyment of the smoke.  The older they get the better they are.  I didn't think that would be possible.  An outstanding smoke.

title: Montecristo  Sublimes LE 2008
review_text: Average

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2006
review_text: Much of the criticism of this cigar reminds me of that which was pointed at the 2003 LE Montecristo 'C'.  Both cigars were pretty muted on release but the 'C' is now one of my all time favourite cigars.  It seems that most Monte's benefit from a reasonable period of ageing before some of the more secondary complex flavours develop.  I bought a box of these robustos and have decided to stop half way through and not touch them for another year or two.  It's not that any of them have been unpleasant.  I've found them to be mellow, creamy and mouth filling with subtle flavours but I suspect that they will get much much better with age.

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2006
review_text:
This is one of my favourites cigars.
Sweet, nutty, medium flowers taste and well balanced flavor.
Montecristo taste tobacco.
I love it!

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2006
review_text: Beautiful robusto. Nice ash, nice draw. The flavor is first very elegant and pretty mild. Having sweet and earthy character with hint of capuccino. At the second half the flavor is getting more powerful having aromas like spicynes and pine. Not "very Montecristo taste" but it is something new and kind of refreshing. I would recommend this.

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2006
review_text:
It's not a bad cigar, but the taste was quite average. The taste would be best described as leathery and bitter. 

It doesn't compare to the neither of the Montecristo Especiales but yet, costs more. If you want to try this I would probably buy 3 as a test, not the full 25.

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2001
review_text:
Does anyone know why there are Montecristo Robustos Edicion Limitada 2000 with just the EL band and some with the 2001 band? Would be great if someone could help me out with that!
Thanks a lot

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2001
review_text:
I smoked this cigar a while back.
While the construction wasn't really premium, the tobacco was magical!
Extremely dark, with an almost square appearance this cigar revealed so many roast flavors, so many congeners and so much aging potential - more than any cigar I can think of. Worse in construction but stellar in tobacco quality compared to the younger LE Monte Robusto.

title: Montecristo  Robusto LE 2001
review_text:
Smoked another one tonight. After the last one being too tight, this one was somewhat "underfilled" and was a struggle to keep properly burning.
It started strong, but tasted very mellow and really mature in the first half. In fact, it tasted like an OLD cigar - complex, subtle yet intese - but very ripe. Picked up in spiciness and density in the second half, became more peppery, with the final third being most enjoyable. Oily-coating, matured tobacco.
The main character still was the charred wood component, imparted by the wrapper. Clearly a relative of the Millenium Jarre Robustos, but much more advanced in its development. That might very well be the difference in packaging affecting the ageing. All in all, a great 1,25 hour smoke!

title: Montecristo  Regata
review_text: I am not a fan of the OPEN series, except this one. Beautifull cigar: 50 minutes smoke, made of very very roasted nuts along with lots of cedar. A cigar with the perfect duration for the kind of intense favour it holds. Just medium in strenght, though.

title: Montecristo  Regata
review_text: Well my review may not mean much as I am a novice but this cigar has been my hands down favourite smoke thus far.  I finally understood many of the flavours mentioned in numerous reviews peppers, wood, fruit ect.  and it burned great.  I wouldn't call these cheap as another reviewer did.  They seem to be priced in the middle of the pack where I live. But worth every penny.

title: Montecristo  Regata
review_text: One of my favorites from the Open line.  The only problem with the Regata is that it is consistently under filled which can lead to too much smoke over over heating.  The flavours are fantastic and it's a great size.  I will always keep a box of these in my humidor.

title: Montecristo  Regata
review_text:
One of the best torpedos of my taste! Or I could name them as the best in all shapes.
Hints of honey, wood, a bit creamy in the 1st third, cedar bomb, earthy.

Just the way I like them! 10/10

title: Montecristo  Regata
review_text: Thanks to various reviews on this informative site, I reconsidered the effects of draw strength and puffed this dark beauty much softer than usual, which resulted in a fine smoke. At 10euro a stick this is a relative good deal in current market. Excellent, even draw throughout with hints of mint. Looked like the ash would have stayed sturdy to the ring (approximately 70 before I flicked it). Uneven burn heading into the final third, but by then I didn't care, and I often save the ends for later anyway. In further caveman style, as I put the tidbit back in the tube, a little strand of the caramel type wrapper tip looked good enough to chew. Tasted the same way.

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Sin Barnizar
review_text: A classic gran corona from an Unvarnished box had a light colorado wrapper, without veins. It had a perfect burn, and produced  flavors of earth, toasted tobacco and light spice. En elegant medium body cigar for slow smoking on a lazy afternoon. A+

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Sin Barnizar
review_text:
Picked up a single from a vintage selection box. Aged since September 1993. Nineteen years has effloresced a well matured gem of a cigar, appealing to the senses. 
An impeccable one and a half hour smoke. Perfect flavours for the novice smoker like myself. Paradisiac hints of chocolate, creamy vanilla and light to medium essences of pure Cuban tobacco which arouse the tastebuds. 
This exquisite cigar had a sensational colorado claro wrapper with very light veins running across the face. 
The burn was impressively even throughout the duration of the smoke, with a firm, yet even draw. 
The only critique I can propose was that it ended all too soon...

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Sin Barnizar
review_text: I found a box EOG CCNU.Nice colorado wrapper,dark ash.Good construction,draw.Very pleasant taste,cedar,coffee,cocoa powder,leather with some spicy in the end.Milder the other Partagas,not peppery.Distinctive cigar.

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Sin Barnizar
review_text: Turn out to be one of my favorite cigar. I got this vintage box from my cigar shop. Unlike other Partagas, this one is not very spicy. Creamy and wood test. Very beautiful wrapper. No need to re-light. This box be my keeper.

title: Montecristo  Petit Tubos
review_text: Almost two years after my previous "review" on these,I'm returning just to confirm how good the PT's are.Still have lots from 2003 and are simply wonderful cigars.

title: Montecristo  Petit Tubos
review_text: So far great taste but the draw is hard.burn is even. Smells like chocolate. Very artistic.

title: Montecristo  Petit Tubos
review_text: Really good for the price, very tasty and draws well

title: Montecristo  Petit Tubos
review_text: Lots of special offers this summer and these were no exception. Very nice, consistent and imo slightly better too than the no.4

title: Montecristo  Petit Tubos
review_text:
To reviewer #42
Probably if you need to ask you cannot afford!!

title: Partagas  155 Aniversario Salomones I
review_text: I've just smoked one of these, and I must say I was impressed. Due to it's rather unusual shape, when you light it up, the heat take some time to develope, which enhances the rather good, but monotonous taste of the cigar. It has, after the first inch, a good draw, and a wonderful smell when lighted

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Barnizados
review_text: Un gran habano. Gran aroma, muy buen tiro, sabroso. Un acierto seguro,

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Barnizados
review_text: As always splendid presentation, overall very good construction a few slightly firmer draw than I prefer. The ones that drawer well are outstanding nice to smoke slow and long as I find quite full strength. Flavour is complex. I agree with 103 & 104 tasting notes.

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Barnizados
review_text: Just finished my first and was totally blown away! This was a 5 year aged and you can tell that it needs its aging considering the strength but now it delivers magic! Excellent constuction, rich flavors, thick smoke and beautiful sweetness to it! Loved this one

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Barnizados
review_text: Smoked a couple straight out of the box and they were pretty good, not spectacular. The next few appear to have gone into hibernation. Real curious to see when they return, hopefully in a big way!

title: Partagas  8-9-8 Barnizados
review_text: Really all I can say is Partagas at her best. Red hued wrapper. Opens with a kick of spice for a couple of puffs. Retro delivers intense cedar. Salt flavor comes in and out on multiple puffs. 2nd third is cedar and a sweetness on the retro, a nice creamy texture to the thick smoke output. Salt returns with honey sweetness on retro accompanied by a woody flavor, and cocoa. Last third has a unique chocolate flavor, and salt that was muted by the cigars youth. Med/ full body.Very co p!ex stick. Great construction, burn ect. What a stick. Great smoke young. With age sky is the limit.

title: Partagas  Aristocrats
review_text: lovely daily smoke. at first it felt a bit harsh imo, but it developed a good amount of sweetness later on. for it's price, it's a pretty good cigar.

title: Partagas  Aristocrats
review_text: It's a especially Partagas

title: Partagas  Aristocrats
review_text: First 15 minutes of smoking was not bad to boring mild flavours with little smoke coming out of my mouth . But after that the rest of about 40 minutes the ARISTOCRATES was just pleasure with lots of smoke and loads of leather and rich tabacco flavours.

title: Partagas  Aristocrats
review_text: Definitely partagas flavor.Cream,sweetness, toasted tobacco, and signature partagas pepper. A good cigar for the price point. If you are looking for a medium bodied partagas experience, this is it.

title: Partagas  Aristocrats
review_text: A long time fan of Partagas, I find these to be a true Partags. Excellent construction well beyond its quite low price and better than many more expensive cigars.For me it is the perfect "every-day" smoke.My JUN 13 boxes smoke just fine now.A solid 10 in all respects imo.

title: Partagas  155 Aniversario 109
review_text: I got one fotunately from a friend who is fever cigar collector and smoke now. Full of media power with pepper, wood, and some cream taste. The taste is mellow, not strong enough, maybe the result of ten years maturing. It's a nice cigar, but not traditional patargas style and far beyond wonderful, IMHO.

title: Partagas  150 Aniversario Coronas Grandes
review_text: Hard to find, and worht a lot, I had the pleasure of smoking one on my birthday this year.  Subtle almond and light cappucino come forward, and it builds up as it is smoked.  Light hints of nougat, and cocao were in the background.

title: Partagas  150 Aniversario Robustos
review_text: I smoked this one recently and very much enjoyed it.  I could certainly sense the age (12-13 years by the time I got to it).  I have only had one, but the lasting impression is that its a silky and delicate stick, very different than the typical Partagas

title: Partagas  150 Aniversario 109
review_text: I smoked one of these many years ago. I still have the scarring from where I burnt my fingers ! I did not want this powerhouse to end. Partagas hit a home run with these. Pepper and earthy wonderfulness a hint of coffee with cocoa the room was engulfed in a cloud of bliss. If you are ever lucky enough to get your hands on one of these do it one is worth $200 just to experience this heavenly smoke gave a 9 as the 10 will not happen until I have had one of the Davidoff 5000s from 58

title: Partagas  150 Aniversario 109
review_text: My boy just hooked me up with a couple of this bad boys directly from Cuba. I agree with the heavy pepper flavour. Nothing Mild about this cigar, this cigar starts off an ass kicking full flavor stogie. Limited edition hard to find and what a treat. Best Partagas I have had!!!! Hands down!!!!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Selectos
review_text: I bought a box of 50 in 2011 from a well known Habanos internet retailer. 10 packs of 5 cigars.  Slightly sweet start and good flavor for the first 4/5th.  The last 20% is un-smoke-able unless you are drunk. This box was the only one I have seen for sale on that website in the 6 years I have been doing business with them.  Given this brand is extinct, the 35 I have left are priceless. Thus they rate a 6 for flavor & 10 for collectability. "Extinct" makes them unobtainable, so it looks like I have some of the very few left in the world.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Selectos
review_text: LOC-08/2000. Bought a box of 50, and have enjoyed every cigar so far. Medium taste with tobacco and herbal flavors.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Selectos
review_text: After buying a box of 5 in Macau, I found that it has some yellow remain on the paper box, which I suppose to be aged signals of cigars. After taking one, I found that it had pure Cuban cigar aroma. I was doubt at first that how possible machine made cigars could have such aroma. After knowing that this brand discontinued in 2005, I finally know that it is 7-year-old cigar! How amazing it was.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Selectos
review_text: Found a bunch of aged 5-pks for sale and picked up 10.  Nice smoke for a very fair price, considering they're cut-fillers, they burn and taste very nice!  Occasional burn corrections, but no draw problems so far, out of the 6 I've smoked.  The flavors are herbal, and of rich tobacco, turning more coffee-like towards the end.  Great deal, too bad theyre not made anymore.  I may have to buy some more before my vendor runs out!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Delirios
review_text: Delirios are mighty tasty. A cigar that hasn't seen the light of day since 2005. A herbaceous cigar with a fairly medium draw. Enjoyed it in -15 degree weather going for a walk. Don't smoke at all in the winter, but felt a bit down and wanted a taste of the summer. Sunny day, cold weather, sweet cigar. Finding them might be hard, but if you can then grab a box of ten and enjoy.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Delirios
review_text:
Good draw, good burn, good taste and even better price!!
Get them while you can!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Delirios
review_text:
I ordered a box of these, sight unseen, as the price looked good, and I am trying to build a stock of old machine-mades, before they are gone for good. 
Was pleasantly surprised when the box was delivered - 50 cigars, not 25! 
Five ten-count boxes, packed together.
Even better, the cigars have been consistantly excellent. 
They burn evenly and well, avoiding the extremes of over and underfilling too often found in machine-made Cubans. 
While they are neither complex nor taste bombs, they are very pleasant, flavourful, well balanced, medium bodied and typically Cuban. 
Very old-school, in the best sense of the phrase. 
An excellent afternoon smoke, stepping out from work for a break. 
I have ordered three more boxes, as the first one is almost done.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Delirios
review_text: A really good cheap cigar. No ammonia taste at all, very good draw and burn: tipo all for just a couple of CHF!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Delirios
review_text: I had the pleasure of smoking my first Los Statos last night.  While these cigars are a little smaller than I prefer, I highly enjoyed it.  Great flavor, AWESOME burn, and thick ash.  I'll be searching for more of these.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Brevas
review_text: Hola. Long time without being seen in Spain, they were a classic smoke here along with Quintero Brevas. I would not recomend both Brevas to novice smokers, specially the fresh new rolled ones. High strength, almost bitter taste. Very 'Vieja Guardia' (Old School) style.

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Brevas
review_text:
My bundle of 96s has come around somewhat with time for humidification and oxidation inside the bundle, but they are still hit or miss and not overly great. They mostly show some nice sweetness, but no remarkable substance or even annoying, almost flawed tastes of gum or cabbage. Prolonged time with oxygen allowed into the bundle definitely is not for their good. The ash on all sticks is unreal white for a Cuban cigar, which might be due to planting region or high use of Magnesium that year...
After half the bundle, there were maybe two sticks out of ten that were good to great. No comparison to the '98s again, colour assortment is not well done on the '96s either. Hit or miss, but at least not too great a loss. Construction also ranges from loose to firm, but no plugged ones here. However, I would love to have a few plugged ones if the rest were as great as the 98s...

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Brevas
review_text:
With still hand-made Brevas bundles available from 1996-2000, these are a good value for a casual smoke.
Two samples from 2000 caught my attention and just tasted great, comparable to matured Quintero Brevas, quite full bodied and a magnificient, straight Cuban profile.
Having smoked through one bundle of each 96 and 98, I would favour the 98s.
96 ones are well constructed, with almost too light draw, but just have an "ok" taste. A bit woodsy, nutty, still a bit drying, not very full - ok at their price, but nothing more...
Of the 98s, all were packed tighter, resulting in almost 10 pieces being plugged.
But rewarding for those failures, all smokeable ones were blockbuster, rich, dense, oily textured, just delicious smokes being worth a multiple of their price.
Having to judge, the tobaccos used must have been from different growing regions, with 98s being Vuelta Abajo ones (and 96s Vuelta Arriba or Oriente) - just a guess, but very intriguing.
One characteristic of the packaging is that each bundle is very "reductive" and dry when coming. 
A hay-like, black tea leaf smell, but they need weeks in the humidor in order to taste good, as the dry ones will be very agressive, drying and bitter.
The more the bundle gets emptier, the more do the cigars change. They obviously oxidize, take on a new aroma. This can be for the good within the first weeks, but thinking in a period of several months, the change is not for the good any more!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Brevas
review_text: This was a very surprising smoke. My experience with Los Statos de Luxe is limited, but I was very impressed with the Brevas. Very smooth. Good balance. A great combination of fine Cuban tobacco. There is definitely a sweet "woody" taste to this cigar. Great cigar for little money!

title: Los Statos de Luxe  Brevas
review_text: Very good. I have been smoking 5 from my 98, and they were all very satisfying and with surprisingly consistent quality - no problems whatsoever so far. Nice wrappers. Mine are Totalmente a mano, with short filler. Strong, full "dark" flavour; taste as in review #2. I have tried many budget smokes and these are not only the cheapest but by far the best at just over 1 Euro/stick in Switzerland. Score in relation to price: 10/10.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 5
review_text: LAR OCT 13 - Smoked entire box - very good overall. Medium-dark wrapper, medium wrapper thickness. Classic Monte bean flavors with tangy citrus overtones. Medium plus strength. Good examples of Monte 5. Solid 92 points--could be 93+ if the Perla size didn't hamper it and the burning and construction were a bit sharper throughout. Not a dud in the box. Some 93, some 91. Monte has been consistent for quite a few years. No hesitation buying any Montes 2010-2015.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 5
review_text: I recently got back into smoking the occasional cigar and went through four different brands in quick succession, all moderately low-price, in order to see if I could ascertain where my tastes lay. This was the most recent, and by far the best. Enjoyed with a small glass of Bowmore, draw not too tight nor too loose. Slight sour notes in the flavour that I hadn't tasted in any other cigars (almost like cider) but that were pleasant.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 5
review_text: A wonderful cigar that is a top choice in the perla/small cigar realm. Flavors always have cocoa, mocha, can vary from light to dark chocolate taste. Espresso flavors as well. I find these are best with at least 3 years of age. This is my most-smoked cigar and if was shipwrecked and could choose an endless supply of one cigar, this would be it.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 5
review_text: A great smoke indeed, especially for the price. Mine was a 09 box so 5 years ageing has worked wonders.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 5
review_text: Very good cigar. Spicy, aromatic and still smooth to smoke. I recommend it.

title: Montecristo  Petit Edmundo
review_text: Box dates: Nov & Dec 2015: Really loving these - they've become my daily staple. Good construction, classic flavors, and fairly consistent over 4 boxes

title: Montecristo  Petit Edmundo
review_text: The most sumptuous smell I ever tried on a cigar - pure sweet chocolate. A truly remarkable (and unforgetable) event.the flavours, however, were clearly absent - perhaps too young. For that reason, only a 7; otherwise, this would be a clear 9 !!!

title: Montecristo  Petit Edmundo
review_text:
Love the vitola for it's compact stature/flavors compared to length of stick.  While definitely young (I'm thinking 6-8 years to go), there was one remarkable draw that really spoke to what this could become.  Just an overwhelmingly rich dark chocolate waft when I had all about given up on the last 3rd.

Flavors are coming along nicely (toast, cocoa, tea, honey, coffee, milk, caramel, vanilla, nuts, leather, cedar).  Cocoa, cedar, leather at play for a majority of the first 2 thirds.

Construction wise I was smoking the black sheep of my 2 boxes (split foot).  Draw was a tad tight.  Opened nicely during the latter half.  Burned cool.  Needed touch ups.

Take one for a test drive.  Serves a very nice little niche at a convenient price point.

title: Montecristo  Petit Edmundo
review_text: Very Good.  I have another 9 to go and looking forward to them.  Almost burnt my fingers trying to get the last bit.

title: Montecristo  Petit Edmundo
review_text: I smoke my first Petit Edmundo 2 weeks ago and ... I bought 3 more of them the next day; totally loved it! As the presentation says, it strongly smells the good tobacco. The draw is sublime, open but not too loose; just perfect. And, of course, the typical Montecristo taste is here. I don't know exactly why, but I prefer this version than the classic Edmundo and the Double Edmundo... Maybe this one is more dynamic and nervous. A great cuban piece, you need one in your humidor.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Tubos
review_text: You cannot find a bad Montecristo tubos.  They are impeccably rolled.  The flavours grow from medium-full to full and the tabacco used is perfectly balanced.  I rarely find burn issues with these cigars.  Pure class from Montecristo.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Tubos
review_text: I was able to buy some singles of these beauties from 2001 and 2003.I have smoked a few and all I can say is that they are absolutely great.In fact is a step closer to cigar Heaven.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Tubos
review_text: got 2x boxes from 2009 different factory and month codes. Both consistent in appearance and construction. Very nice Monte flavour profile, slight citrus tang - complex medium strength becoming fuller towards last third. Out of 30 smoked a few slightly firm on the draw but not too tight to enjoy. Attractive to look at at and a great size for an hour of pleasure!!

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Tubos
review_text: very nice earthy aromas, comes along with some power, construction and draw very solid; a recommendation!

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Tubos
review_text:
An unique experience! Great cigar!
The flavours come very quickly, cause of its size. The burn is fine, draw is excellent, the flavours are sweety woody, fresh aroma and coffee. very creamy.
trully satisfied! if u like montecristo blend, try this one!

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4 Reserva
review_text: Great flavor,great aroma, classical monte flavor but more smooth, more balanced.Smoked it in 20 minutes lasted like 2 cigarettes, 30% better than a normal monte 4, 300% more expensive. In my opinion not worth 25 Euros for a 20 min smoke. Same tobacco on a churchill I would have paid even double. Here you pay the extra band.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4 Reserva
review_text:
Smooth wrapper and dense. The burn was slow and even. Typical Montecristo flavours with tanginess and smooth creamy texture.

I noticed more spice on the nose than the usual No. 4s. What was most apparent is the nicotine kick! Not sure if it is just my stick. 5 more to go but I will horde these for a while. A little young with a great destiny.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4 Reserva
review_text: A rich, creamy cigar.  Perfect construction and burn.  A joy.  In a different league than the regular Monte No. 4

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4
review_text:
Dark wrapper.  Looks good.  No visual flaws.  On lighting up, immediate issue as draw was too tight and smoke output was therefore limited.
Coffee and cocoa tastes in the first third.  Mild flavour which only approached medium in the final third.  Intriguing cigar and kept going to the final inch and a half.  Really would like to taste this without the tight draw as it had real potential.  Had with a porter and a Leffe Bruine.  Good accompaniment.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4
review_text: Dear Joaozinho30 - very much agree with your evaluation of this cigar. For some reason it still is the most sold cuban cigar in the world. Please reach me by mrmcgoo_2000@yahoo.com if you want to share some boxes of CasaHavaneza, in Portugal (also a great fan of RyJ).

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4
review_text: Delicious thick smoke, very good constrution, excelent draw, earthy and coffee flavours. A good one hour smoke.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4
review_text: Great cigar for newbies! Starts with a mild earth taste with a hint of a sweet after taste. Starts to shift towards spicy pepper after midway point. Burn is almost razor sharp and smokes really well.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 4
review_text: Really good cigar, also not too pricey for the quality. Bought three boxes of 25, and I have to say a few them present a bad construction, as they are rolled too tight and smoke doesnt draw well. around 20% of them present this issue, and 1 of 2 out of every box were unsmokable, and I had to cut them.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 3
review_text: Nice, but not outstanding. Well balanced, good flavours but lacks some body. Overall a nice afternoon cigar.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 3
review_text: Good cigar. Mild to medium in body, with a good combination of sweet spices and woody flavour. Lack the beany/toasty notes of the no. 4 and much more subtle but very satisfying smoke.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 3
review_text:
Good draw with a bit of resistance.
Starts off mainly spicy and peppery. Settles into a creamy with notes of mainly vanilla and cocae.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 3
review_text: Nice aroma,moderate taste good for an outdoor smoke

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 1
review_text: This is the only cigar that my friend enjoys.  That is why I try and fine them whenever I can.  He claims they are a robust and a fantastic smoke.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 1
review_text: A sublime long panetela and the absolute pinnacle of Cuban tobacco flavor in a small ring gauge cigar. After eighteen years this box of Especials is simply magnificent. I Will weep when the box is gone.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 1
review_text: Despite being a young cigar, this one has blown me away with the intensity and complexity of flavors. Do not buy these and leave them all for me.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 1
review_text: JAN 14 - Very smooth out of the gates. Very light milk chocolate flavors come straight away. As a surprise with such a young stick, there was an absolute lack of harshness. Cuban twang was in the far background. Not much change in the second third, just beautifully robust, and creamy chocolate. The body kicked up to a medium full here, but was never harsh at all. During the final third, company came over as I was finishing up and I started pulling a little to hard on it. This made the cigar fairly hot and flavors turned bitter. Overall, this was a fantastic smoke. Just have to remember to smoke slowly.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 1
review_text: I smoked my first Especial in 1969, must have been rolled in 1965. Definitely within my three favourite Habanos, although I do not have the opportunity to smoke it often and, nowadays with the restrictions, you have to be in the right country and place to enjoy it peacefully with friends around and pertinent drinks.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 1
review_text: When good these are one of the most underrated smokes! Elegant, refined, sophisticated...Wonderful evolvement staring light and developing to med/full. Hint of cedar along with all the best of the MC profile of flavours. My most recent box just one year of age and very good indeed - am smoking half the box now and have put the other half away to age. Medium colour, beautiful box pressed appearance - all round deliscious.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 1
review_text: I have recently tried another #1 I got in 2004 on my wedding vacation, and man o man it keeps getting better and better. A classic smooth medium flavour and a great constancy throughout the 3 stages. Can't wait to see what another couple years will add.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 1
review_text: This is a very refined cervantes, maybe my favorite when done right with the high-end mellow, nutty, complex and evolving tobacco found in the best specimens and/or boxes. But as with many overly popular vitolas and brands, one may easily come across below-par, bland or even counterfeited #1s. So watch out and always buy from reputed vendors... I bought three perfectly-constructed singles last week and smoked one today which gave me absolute satisfaction. So my score (actually 9.5) reflects my opinion of such specimens.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 1
review_text: sept 2011 - opened a great looking box and was even happier when I smoked them - finished the top layer and all have been spot on except the first one - should have waited a few days to let them settle from shipping. Amazing the difference now... darkish and uniform box pressed beautiful construction. nice and complex retaining elegance and slowly building in complexity and strength.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 1
review_text: Dark, oily wrapper, perfect draw, rich medium bodied cocoa flavor. Wonderful!

title: Montecristo  Montecristo D LE 2005
review_text: Very disappointing and one dimensional cigar.  Construction is flawless, but the flavors just don't develop.  Had such high hopes.....

title: Montecristo  Montecristo D LE 2005
review_text: smoked only one of two which i found in a tabacos store in Spain.after nine years of good keeping,because the cigar was in very good shape,i found me having a very good experiece.the draw was good, smoke was plenty, burn was good and the taste was interesting ,strong taste, not very complex.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo D LE 2005
review_text: This was a very disappointing cigar... Very bland and boring, dry hay and one dimensional. I actually felt like I was wasting my time smoking it. Since it was a 2005 Montecristo, I was hoping for much better.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo D LE 2005
review_text: Oily, deep dark brown almost Maduro wrapper. Good burn and construction .... from then on all downhill .... bland, boring and with anything which might have been interesting smothered beneath a heavy and monotonous wood/leather base. A disappointing cigar, the regular production Montecristo No 1 is far, far better.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo D LE 2005
review_text: I think these are disapointing. After 6 years of aging I have a bland and boring smoke.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo B
review_text: great cigar for a great moment,is like walking in the old habana streets with the music of Compay in your mouht while you smoke this exclusive cigar

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 2
review_text: This is a classic for me.  There were two boxes at La Estrella in Cayo Santa Maria in March.  I bought one.  Hard to find, but when you do, buy it!  This is such a good cigar, even young, despite what reviewer #50 thinks.  If new cigar smokers get over the big ring gauge fad and look at a classic like this, they'll so learn what cigar connoisseurs already know.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 2
review_text: Ok, Yes great cigar, but I think not as great as it should be. I had 12 in my humidor and I am smoking ones in a while one. Have smoke 8 so far and they are getting better and better. I wouldnt recommend to smoke this cigar though when its young. I did that and it was very disappointing. A year after though, yes, it a really nice cigar. Spicy, creamy and earthy. Draw very good. Burning... not that good. I have to correct and light again once in a while. For me for that kind of cigar I would expect that to be great as well. I hope the other 4 that I still have will be better.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 2
review_text: Great cigar,all Monte flavours are there in abundance.Never had a bad one of these.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo Especial No. 2
review_text: Wonderful cigar. Rich & full bodied. Especially strong for a Montecristo. Good draw & even burn.From JUL 2013.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 2
review_text: This is a classic cigar, one everyone must try when properly aged. Very dense and with many intense flavours, the most important (and original) being an amazing wet earth. If young, these cigars get very strong, though; so, have patience and hold them on the humidor for around one year.

title: Montecristo  Maravillas
review_text: Bought 3 loose sticks from CigarsUnlimited about 3 years ago. Smoked one this past Wednesday and it was an awesome experience. This was created to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the Montecristo Brand. Wish they celebrate every year, so we can all enjoy cigars of this quality on a regular basis. Even though this was a huge cigar, but the draw was effortless. The ash was solid and in sterling silver color. These are all signs of a well constructed cigar.  If you think that 2008 Limited Edition Montecristo Sublime is the best cigar ever, it only means you have not tasted this Maravillas No. 1. With that said, at 54 quid a stick, this is a premium cigar at a premium price. Smoke it if you can afford it. You will not be disappointed.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo C LE 2003
review_text: I am not impressed with this one att all.Expected much more.Bought only one to try,because i saw low score on this site and score is quite right.Uneaven burn,very low substance on taste,solid draw,overall not so good limitada.Nice looking,but tat is all.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo C LE 2003
review_text: Astonishing beginning for a cigar that is finally ready to be smoked. Medium to full body and a robust mixture of wood and earthly flavors throughout. I find the Corona Gorda size to be the most enjoyable in the Habanos lineup and this is the ideal 1h 30min afternoon smoke for 2011. Find them and smoke them.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo C LE 2003
review_text: bought two boxes in '04 and smoked one up at that time. not too impressed. began smoking them again in '09 and they had developed into one of the finest cigars i have ever tasted. time made all the difference on this one.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo C LE 2003
review_text: I let them sit for many years and every once in a while I will smoke one. This is my second box. I went thrugh the first one very quickly and I loved them back then. When I smoked one a few months ago i was disapponited. They were bland, not very complex and I questioned my memory of a few years ago. I read many reviews that these get better over time but I did not experience it. I also was very disappointed with the Hoyo pyramid 2003 since they were just dead after all these years. They were horrible. Makes me think that the LE cigars in every brand are a hit or miss with aging since no one really knows how they will end up.Whenever I buy LE cigars now I buy then in singals and enjoy them for what they are there and then. Not taking a chance of paying a high price and rolling the dice. Monty C 2003 is ok. Beautiful wrapper. Gets strong towards the end but as I said very one dimentional.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 2
review_text: Smoked two from a 2015 box and found both of them to be perfectly constructed. The flavor, however, was very mild. There was a hint of cocoa, wood, and mild leather.  It was very enjoyable, but not as flavorful add I would have liked.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 2
review_text: These are just tremendous cigars.  I have had several boxes recently.  My oldest box is five years of age, and they are milder with a classic Cadillac draw and feel, smooth and like leather.  The wrappers are super oily and rich.  The younger cigars are also excellent, with the classic monte twang and spicy ness.  I have compared these to Upmann and Diplomatico #2 and there is really no comparison.  The draw, construction and burn are much better.  I have never had a bad draw or bad burn ever, on any of these after 75 or so.  All I can say is these are the best or second best Havana's out there.  No doubt and you will not be disappointed.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 2
review_text:
Starts off with molasses, biscuits, dark chocolate and damp soil. Progresses into toasted tobacco, fresh baked cookies, and furniture polish accompanied by a persistent tingling sensation. The final stretch is characterized by bitterness and menthol. 

The draw was very comfortable and the ash was a snowy white. With 5+ years of age, these cigars really start to sing. Totally different experience than smoking a fresh one.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo No. 2
review_text: Dry boxed for 24hrs, lovely dark and oily wrapper shade. Youthful and exuberant with notes of brown toast, hazelnut and cinnamon. Perfect draw, great after oxtail braised in a red wine sauce. The perfect antidote to wannabe US look alike cigars. This is the reason why we smoke Cubans.

title: Montecristo  Junior
review_text: Cocoa and cappuccino  flavors? Definately! But I don't agree with other reviewers who said it has a spicy strong flavor. It's a cool great cigar, not too complex, however I felt that in the first third it had a hard draw. And yes, you should smoke this one while relaxing, with a nice view, and a good cup of coffee

title: Montecristo  Junior
review_text: A $9 Mocha-chino! Cocoa, Coffee, and cream. Cool burning. Pure enjoyment.

title: Montecristo  Junior
review_text: Reasonably priced,not very complex,but very nice small cigar.Very well rolled, nice draw and nice flavors.

title: Montecristo  Junior
review_text: Great little cigar, spicy and strong flavor, not expensive, perfect for a good talk with expresso.

title: Montecristo  Junior
review_text: Great little cigar, spicy and strong flavor, not expensive, perfect for a good talk with expresso.

title: Montecristo  Edmundo Dantes El Conde 109
review_text: One of the best, if not the best Regional Exclusivo ever produced. The only draw back is it cost over $750 a box when I purchased it back in 2008. Unfortunately, they did not make enough of this and it is a shame that a cigar this good cannot be enjoyed on a regular basis.

title: Montecristo  Edmundo Dantes El Conde 109
review_text: AUG07 - Gorgeous Double Corona with tapered head - cookie dough on a base of toasted tobacco, practically without any wood or earth - delicious!

title: Montecristo  Montecristo A
review_text: Wow.... this is a cigar to really stand out. It is presented in an elegant nice cedar coffin, that contains once cigar each. The vitola gran corona is the biggest one in regular production. It can asure a long 2,5 hours at least. Be prepared to smoke this cigar, you really do not want to trow it away because something else require your atention.    The cigar itself have two problems that i have finded as mixing mi own experience and talking with other aficionados; firstly, the size leaves a lot of margin to plugs... it is very sad to find that a Montecristo A is plugged, because is a shame to trow away or to suffer for 2 hours a cigar. The second issue is of course the price. The cigar is very pricy, and with that money you can buy a lot of minutos or robustos, so is up to you to decide if it is worth. Now, taking those 2 points in consideration, the cigar itself is a different animal than any other montecristo cigar; not slightly similar to the n2 or edmundos. The cigar is mild but have a complex and rich flavor profile. The smoke output is always in the tight side, and more silky than creamy. A very elegant cigar that will have a lot of variations during the smoke, but never getting a lot of strenght. Overall, a very good cigar that will keep you  entretained for more than 2 hours, but maybe can be to much to a lot of aficionados. Due the high price and the probability of getting a pluged one, i am very carefull to recomend this cigar to anyone. Get it at your own risk. This can be either a sublime experience, or a crappy one.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo A
review_text:
IM PROBABLY THE MOST EXPERIENCED CIGAR SMOKER ON THIS WEBSITE- So here is my review. What an exceptional cigar to say the very least.Great construction & strangely enough a perfect draw which is quite surprising given its size. One word of warning, not a beginners cigar as only real cigar aficionados like my myself have learned to appreciate the fine art of cigar smoking. Anyone can smoke a cigar but to really enjoy the complex flavours of this Monte A it would be wasted on most people as the flavours must be delicately savoured for 2 hours of shear smoking pleasure. 

I aged my Monte A for at least 6 mths & this is a perfect example of a fine Cuban cigar if having the time to smoke this masterpiece. This Monte A had typical Montecristo flavours but ever so refined, due to the aging my Monte A had.This cigar is simply cigar heaven if smoked correctly as many people have no idea on how to smoke a cigar, if smoked the right way to savour the complex flavours of this very well constructed Cuban cigar.

Overall, this cigar is a must try as it is a very fine example of an elegant Cuban cigar that can be smoked up to 2 hours. Again only try this cigar if oneself can appreciate a very well constructed Cuban cigar.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo A
review_text: Incredible that tobacco leafs have the potencial, when grown in the reddish soil of the Vuelta Abajo, to become what is this cigar, Montecristo A. If I only could smoke one cigar for the rest of my life, this is the one. Incredible, bust be smoked to be believed.

title: Montecristo  Montecristo A
review_text: just a perfect cigar for a great moment

title: Montecristo  Joyitas
review_text: probably the worst montecristo I've ever had, even the small mechanized puritos are better than these

title: Montecristo  Joyitas
review_text: A bit disappointing, diffult draw and tight. Middle section is good and nice flavour, though the last third is harsh. If these were the only Montecristo's you tried you could come to the wrong conclusion about this great brand

title: Montecristo  Joyitas
review_text: This cigar is like a cross between a cigarette and a cigar - good if you want to transfer to the good stuff. Clearly not for the seasoned smoker. Anyone considering these would do a world better going for the EdM demi-tasse unless of course you are trying to get off the wicked side of the weed.

title: Montecristo  Joyitas
review_text: I've had a few of these, they are certainly no substitute for a larger Montecristo. One of them had a difficult draw. I found these are best during the last third. Only worth a try if you're really pressed for time.

title: Montecristo  Master
review_text: Meh. Not bad but not extremely tasty, however the flavour gets more intense in the last third. I agree with review #5 that when compared with this one regata is better. Not an excellent robusto all in all

title: Montecristo  Master
review_text: I am a fan of the Montecristo Open line. It is good when they come up with new but quality products.  The Master are not my favorite though. Regata is better. Construction can be better! Otherwise lots of coffee and earthy flavors.

title: Montecristo  Master
review_text: Open air smoke. On the beach, cool winter breeze...Light open draw, light tobacco taste and gets stronger as it comes to the end. For sure this is my favorite vitola.

title: Montecristo  Master
review_text: In my opinion the OPEN series is just a marketing strategy...Smoked some of each vittola from the series and was not impressed. It is a novice smoker,s cigar.Easy draw,burn and light taste.

title: Montecristo  Master
review_text: Great looking stick, with a fairly loose and easy draw. Earth, black pepper are the main flavours that develop in the beginning third. The remainder of the cigar stays predominantly woody throughout.

title: Montecristo  Grand Edmundo
review_text: What a great stick. Flavors are smooth, creamy and filled with coco. I can repeat previous reviews, all I can say is developing very well. Great Cigar for you Monte fans !

title: Montecristo  Grand Edmundo
review_text: had to review this cigar before even finishing it...excellent.smooth and creamy...perfect cigar experience

title: Montecristo  Grand Edmundo
review_text: This is a great, smooth smoke. But not as good as the Sublime.

title: Montecristo  Grand Edmundo
review_text: If it is OK, it is a very good cigar. The construction is not always the best LE cigar. My Box SEP OCT 10. In one piece i found the beetle larvae. This should not happen by LE. I hope that the rest will be fine, because this cigar aging well. Now is better than last year. The smoke is rich and creamy. Given the problems already I will not buy another box.

title: Montecristo  Grand Edmundo
review_text: All of the Edmundo flavor only more so. Creamy smoke with vanilla, honey, cocoa and earth. Fine construction with an even burn and good draw.

title: Montecristo  Double Corona LE 2001
review_text:
Only thing that i really wanted is to baobab,my friend,who,you can tell,is a real aficionado,to share with us why does he have a 2001 limitada from 2002.Now,that was my question all about,and i see some of you guys know that.
So i tried to make a bad yoke by a cinic question and it did not go well.
Never mind,x-man fixed the problem and explains it nicely.
So there are some limitadas that were released a bit later.
I never smoked this one,just cant find it and thank you for the post in here you did the story on the reviews and i felt like i smoked one.
Thanx x-man and my friend baobab.

title: Montecristo  Double Corona LE 2001
review_text:
X-man got it all too serious,come on relax.It is obvious that baobab did a mistake on putting the year only by a bad click with his mouse and martsego maybe had a different mistake.
I had no intention on rudely pointing my finger into somebody but if you are saying that somebody did some nonsence just try not to do the same yourself.
Well it is a touche and if you can believe it i was the local champion in wrestling greco-roman style in 2000.
Muscles and cigars go well,i mean look at the men ,Schwartz.
No hard feelings we all make mistakes.
And it is good to see when you aknowledge your mistake with honour,it says that you are a stand up guy.
C-ya all and happy smokeing.
Sorry for putting this post where it should not be,could not resist it since baobab is cool guy.

title: Montecristo  Double Corona LE 2001
review_text: Touche mon ami!

title: Montecristo  Double Corona LE 2001
review_text: To have 2002 year date on the box code of 2001 Edicion Limitada would not be in correct. As a matter of fact, this cigar was delayed released with Cohiba Piramides, Romeo y Julieta Robustos, Hoyo de Monterrery Particulares, Partagas Serie D No. 3, all Edicion Limitatda 2001. "If you are not having fun, you are doing it wrong."

title: Montecristo  Edmundo
review_text: A very good cigar. Soon as I lit it I could tell it was not a loser, like some cigars I have tried. It has it all. Not outstanding, but I'd buy more and gladly smoke them from here on out. Purchased in December 16' and believe it was from the same year.

title: Montecristo  Edmundo
review_text: What a flavour bomb !!! The flavours of the N. 2 but with salt in the end (very notorious) and without the wet earth. Incredible draw and combustion ! Clear 9 !!!

title: Montecristo  Edmundo
review_text: Dark and lovely. A bit toothy. Unlit aroma has a lovely complex bouquet. First puff was amazing. Salted caramel and creamy coffee mocha flavors with a lot of persistence. Zebra colored ash with a perfect burn. Fairly tight draw is my only complaint.

title: Montecristo  Edmundo
review_text: After only smoking coheba I  thought if give this ago. This was 2 years ago , I have found it to be smoother ,  with a  perfect burn and an adorable cocoa taste. I just wanted it to last longer.

title: Montecristo  Edmundo
review_text: Slightly under medium bodied with nice oily wrappers and zero construction issues to date (eleven cigars from this box). Not a lot of spice but pleasant coffee and cream flavor with a subtle vanilla character. Straight forward earthy tobacco finish provides just enough of a transition to make these cigars interesting. These are good cigars but I don't think they are going to have the legs for real long term aging ( 10+ years).

title: Punch  Souvenir Deluxe HM
review_text: I have a few sticks left, I forgot the taste exactly, I just remmeber that, very smooth, quite tasty. Even a long aged cigar, the taste was kept well in cellophane

title: Punch  Super Robustos Regional Edition 2006
review_text: Just lit taste quite fragrance, taste the first bite is very soft and smooth.It's woody taste very good cigar.

title: Punch  Super Robustos Regional Edition 2006
review_text: Punch Super Robustos ASIA PACIFIC-2006- For sure they need more time. Now they are OK, coffee, floral and nutty notes.Mild and not complex yet. Nothing really special. We will see again in time if they develop to something more interesting

title: Punch  Super Robustos Regional Edition 2006
review_text: The first half is very refined, very nuanced, very characteristically Punch, but the back half needs time, big time.  My guess is these will be hitting their stride around 2017.

title: Punch  Super Robustos Regional Edition 2006
review_text: this cigar sucks. I've had several from a box i bought from a reputable dealer in Australia -- pure soap and cardboard. it looks good. it smells like ammonia. everyone says, "wait 10 years, it will be a classic". Sure.

title: Montecristo  Eagle
review_text:
The double band and gold caught my eye and I decided to try it.  Firstly, the construction.  I was skeptical of it at first because I've had a lot of bad luck with Montecristo wrappers falling apart halfway through the cigar, but no, this stayed together nicely the whole way through.
