The ash fell off with each third very nicely and evenly and the burn stayed even the whole way through.  The draw was loose, which is nice since I like looser draws, and the smoke was voluminous but not too thick.
Now for the flavours.  Coffee the whole way through.  Good Caribbean coffee, mind.  Didn't notice much change in the flavour the whole way through other than the strength of the coffee increasing a bit in the middle and a few notes of cinnamon and hazelnut toward the end of the middle last third.
All in all, not bad, but the flavour was a bit disappointing.  As was mentioned by others, this is perfect if you're outdoors and playing golf or something like that.  You just want a tasty smoke while playing a game rather than sitting down in a lounge for two hours picking out flavours.  If you don't plan on being outside, don't get this.  It's not good relaxing indoors with and it's not got much subtlety in the flavour.  If you like coffee a lot or plan on smoking it outside on a walk, a hike, or a game of golf, get this.
Side note: The outdoorsiness of this was proven to me when I had to leave the pub for a bit while smoking this.  It was a lot more enjoyable outside than it was inside, and warmed me up quite a lot in the cold.
I'll give it an 7 rather than a 6 because a good outdoor cigar like this is uncommon and an interesting experience, but if I hadn't stepped outside, I would have rated it 6.

title: Montecristo  Eagle
review_text: An easy smoke for a Sunday evening. Good draw and burns nicely. Good after taste of coffee.

title: Montecristo  Eagle
review_text:
A very nice cigar perfect for an afternoon.
1/3 light roast beans and smooth
2/3 light to medium roast beans and smooth but slowly developes to medium and a has a nutty taste
3/3 comes back to light strenght and ver tasty
Draw is loose so it smokes quite rapidly
Overall i rate it a 87/100

title: Montecristo  Eagle
review_text:
A very nice cigar perfect for an afternoon.
1/3 light roast beans and smooth
2/3 light to medium roast beans and smooth but slowly developes to medium and a has a nutty taste
3/3 comes back to light strenght and ver tasty
Draw is loose so it smokes quite rapidly
Overall i rate it a 87/100

title: Montecristo  Eagle
review_text:
Big dissapoinment.
just not worth any money or time hanging with it.

title: Punch  Super Selection No. 1
review_text: A cigar with perfect draw but just average combustion. Easy to smoke untill the end because of its cold draw. The flavours profile is very complex and actually hard to describe:  lots of spices, all mixed in a dense and very enjoyable flavour. And the aromas are great. For those who like Punch cigars, this is the best I tasted so far. Oh, and the price is perfect for a (discontinued) corona grande of 60 minutes smoke. An 8.5.

title: Punch  Super Selection No. 1
review_text: Enjoying this CAB and these are really a near perfect Punch cigar for myself. The only thing I've found with this CAB is the ash is weak on most of the ones I have smoked so far. If I had to limit my rotation to only 6 different cigars this would be one of them.

title: Punch  Super Selection No. 1
review_text: Exceptional cigar from 2008 with alluring wood and light cherry notes, wonderful and complex Punch in a classic size.

title: Punch  Super Selection No. 1
review_text: Had one from 2000. Excellent cigar. The draw on mine was tight from extreme aging but the flavor profile was amazing. Tastes of caramel, honey, coffee, wood and cedar all intermingled throughout the cigar, with a very strong menthol blast on the last third. Nubbed it till the very end and was striving for more.

title: Punch  Super Selection No 2
review_text: Simply one of my favorite smokes, I've samples examples from '98, '99, '01, & '02.  Ea somewhat different from the next, but all with that wonderful Punch SS#2 quality.  The '01's were the strongest by far, followed by the '99's.  The '98's are almost a vitola onto theor own.  Full and strong, but balanced and without any harshness at all.  Rasins and oak dominate the first third, followed by stronger hardwood tasts and leather in the second third. The final third produces more leather with a deep, rich spice, quite like fresh ground black pepper.  If smoked slowly during the final inch, a toasty/woodsy taste emerges as well.  Complex, balanced, just a true delihjt to smoke.  If you can fine these, don't hesitate, snap them up!

title: Punch  Super Selection No 2
review_text: I've read several reviews alluding to draw problems with '01 SS2s, but after having smoked through nearly ten cabs of these, I can say that problems have been extremely rare. It's been a marvel of consistency and flavor and will only get better over the next few years.

title: Punch  Super Selection No 2
review_text:
I tried some Cigars of 01 period with impossible draw. Needed lots of massage and they were  still a challenge to smoke. 
Even so , i couldnt stop smoking it. This cigar is a miracle and if you find one with easy draw it has to be perfection. Coffee, spice and lots of sweet sugar and leather at the last 3rd.

title: Punch  Super Selection No 2
review_text: Having been a smoker of fine, handmade cigars for approximately 20 years, it is with due caution that I rate this cigar a perfect ten.  I was fortunate enough to have been able to smoke one recently, and it had everything one could possible look for in it's taste profile.  Complexity, smoothness, balance, flavors such as vinella bean, cream, and mild leather, all atop a bed of light spice.  Razor sharp burn, I nubbed this cigar until my ips and fingers burned.  Thank heavens I was able to procure additional sticks, albeit not nearly enough!

title: Punch  Super Selection No 2
review_text: Finish, finish, finish.  That's all I need to describe this cigar.  It leaves an amazing earthy/spice finish that lingers on and on.  The complexity of the smoke, which ranges from coffee-wood-spice-fruitiness? is sometimes too complicated to keep track of.  I enjoy the Punch Punch for its straightforward flavors, but these can be amazing.  At the same time, however, some of these have tight draws that will drive you crazy!

title: Punch  Serie d'Oro
review_text: This cigar was outstanding! just so complex but strong, like cubans of old. excellent now but the strenght tells me its got many more years to go. fantastic news!!!! a 10 because of what it is and what it will become!

title: Punch  Serie d'Oro
review_text: This has become a decent cigar, much better than when they first came out... Absolutely does not belong at the top of this list. Too many great cigars that overshadow these...

title: Punch  Serie d'Oro
review_text:
Box date listed as ALT-MAY-13. The unlit aroma is quite pungent, but don't let that fool you. This is a quintessential Cuban cigar. Consistent flavors of musky cologne, dried herbs, berries, stone fruits, chocolate toffee bars and a gentle yet poignant rare steak finish. After a puff, the aroma of steak on the grill is so very on point, you would be hard-pressed to believe it. 

Far and away one of the best Cuban cigars I have had the pleasure of smoking. I will thoroughly enjoy making my way through this newly opened box of 25.

title: Punch  Serie d'Oro
review_text: Very good cigar.  Down to less than half in my box and they get better with age!  Very pungent flavors and definitely have the Punch flavor profile.

title: Punch  Serie d'Oro
review_text: Definately one of my top three faves of all times. Excellent construction, draw- razor sharp burn. Above all unique flavors and aromas unlike any other. Got two boxes at the time- storing the other for age. Dedinate 9.5 score.

title: Punch  Royal Coronations
review_text: One of my favorites.Very smooth,light smoke and burns well.You cant beat the price either for the quality you get.

title: Punch  Royal Coronations
review_text: I have smoked this cigar today, my first PUNCH. It is not the best, but for beginers is really good. Is has a distinct taste which I do like, it is light, rich soft flavours and quite linear. I don't feel sorry for buying it. Nice

title: Punch  Royal Coronations
review_text: I had my second Punch (Royal Coronation) which was quite disapponting! Burning is not good, flavors are hardly felt, and draw was pretty tough! I could not believe that it is from the same box of my first cigar. I do not recommend this one. Ashkara!

title: Punch  Royal Coronations
review_text: This is the best cigar I've smoked to this day. It has a nice mild taste and lasts just the right amount of time. For the money you can't do any better.

title: Punch  Royal Selection No. 12
review_text: A mareva starting off with cedar notes that develop into a nice sweet sugar that plays off the Cuban earth notes. Tantalizing.

title: Punch  Royal Selection No. 12
review_text:
These are wonderful, creamy coffee with the odd hint of fruit. The burn and contruction are usually top notch as well.

Its yet another strange decision by habanos to delete these, get your hands on them while you can. They will be sorely missed in years to come.

title: Punch  Royal Selection No. 12
review_text: This is a great petit corona and has always been. Classic medium bodied floral Punch flavors and full taste of spice, leather, and earth. Almost a cinnamon-like flavor emerges after the midpoint. It ends much like it begins with soft spices and creamy notes. I can't understand why HSA is going to delete this one. My advice is to stock out now while you can.

title: Punch  Royal Selection No. 12
review_text: This is a great petit corona and has always been. Classic medium bodied floral Punch flavors and full taste of spice, leather, and earth. Almost a cinnamon-like flavor emerges after the midpoint. It ends much like it begins with soft spices and creamy notes. I can't understand why HSA is going to delete this one. My advice is to stock out now while you can.

title: Punch  Royal Selection No. 12
review_text: This is a great petit corona and has always been. Classic medium bodied floral Punch flavors and full taste of spice, leather, and earth. Almost a cinnamon-like flavor emerges after the midpoint. It ends much like it begins with soft spices and creamy notes. I can't understand why HSA is going to delete this one. My advice is to stock out now while you can.

title: Punch  Royal selection No 11
review_text: Love Punch and these have been very nice in every way except construction. This box has had a high percentage of cigars that have seen the wrappers loosen off near the last third, although the draw has been decent up till then. The flavor is rich and consistent with what I look for in Punch, sweeter spice notes. This was the last RS11 box I have and this is the second last cigar from the box, sad for me. Happy 2017

title: Punch  Royal selection No 11
review_text: The perfect ten.All is here.Medium to full body,delicious chocolate cream bomb!!!

title: Punch  Royal selection No 11
review_text: Enjoy with a breakfast of Espresso, Beef Blinis (no buffalo in Russe) w/ sour cream and a pleasant smoke bought in the heart of Izhevsk!

title: Punch  Royal selection No 11
review_text: Absolutely delightful smoke! Divine, cinnamon, sugar, cream... Shame Habanos discontinued this one...

title: Punch  Royal selection No 11
review_text: Absolutely delightful smoke! Divine, cinnamon, sugar, cream... Shame Habanos discontinued this one...

title: Punch  Poderosos
review_text: Disappointment.I hope the other four for a fiver would be better

title: Punch  Punch Punch
review_text: Full-flavored with bitter herbs, furniture polish, rare steak, heavy cream, and almond skins. Closes up a bit from the middle on, but with much the same profile. A very solid smoke at this point in its lifecycle.

title: Punch  Punch Punch
review_text:
Good straight up smoke featuring Cuban tobacco flavor profile leather and coffee.
I find these nice but not complex

title: Punch  Punch Punch
review_text:
Tight draws abound in this box as well as varying flavor profiles from cigar to cigar. When I get a good one predominate earth, leather and cedar character with a sweet undertone and some delicate spice on the retrohale. Bad ones display a unrelenting black pepper and burnt spice quality and not much else.
Having smoked a lot of these I've always considered the Punch Punch to be a solid but not extraordinary cigar. Unfortunately this is the box I chose to age and it's been a inconsistent mess thus far.

title: Punch  Punch Punch
review_text: These are a good cigar but only if aged for at least 3 years. Before their optimum smoking time they're far tootyoung with very little smoke and poor burning.

title: Punch  Punch Punch
review_text: A good cigar. Opening is spicy and sweet,middle is creamy coffee. Last third is epic and strong. Coffee, chocolate, and a nice pepper. Wish this cigar would have performed the way the last 3rd did all the way through. Good. Not great

title: Punch  Petit Punch
review_text:
Box code: LES NOV 01
This is my second 50's cabinet from Gerard, as it was not difficult to obtain these back in the days. Turns out it would be my last 50's cabinet of Petit Punch, since they stopped producing cabinets around 2002 and 2003. Very fine tobacco scent when i open the cabinet. The wrapper is claro and silky smooth. After 14+ years of aging, one would expect this cigar to be mellow out by now. Boy, was i wrong about that. When i lit up the Petit Punch, the strength and intensity just picked up with each draw. It begins with pepper and leathery taste. After the first third, i started to noticed some notes of wood and floral scents. This is a truly interesting change for such a small cigar. However, even at this Perlas size, this is not a cigar for novice. If you enjoy strong cigars and don't have enough time for a D4 or a Belicoso Fino, then look no further. Hopefully, the 25's dress box age just as well as the cabinet. IMO, this is a 9.3 cigar. The 7.6 it currently sports does not do this cigar any justice. In any case, I am just glad i still have 40+ sticks left.

title: Punch  Petit Punch
review_text: Attractive wrapper. Perfect draw. Perfect burn. Generally woody and peppery. A subtle sweetness emerges progressively during the smoke. Similar to the Romeo y Julieta Petit Princess, but more peppery and less sweet.

title: Punch  Petit Punch
review_text: Sitting poolside at the Melia Las Dunas in Cuba, I lit this Petit Punch and started what would be an impressive cigar.  Perhaps not the best cigar to start the day with I proceeded to smoke a Punch that will "kick you in the ass!"  Powerful, yet not overly powerful, the Petit Punch would be better as a cigar after lunch or dinner, not breakfast.  No doubt it is a Punch.  It is a very high quality Punch.  I'm very impressed with this cigar and have insisted that the Perlas were lead by Dip 5's and Monte 5's, however the Punch Petit Punch may now get my nod as the best Perla.  If you don't like strong, rich tobacco then this cigar may not be for you.  Full, rich, Punch flavours and intense smoke.  I bought a few more singles and a box of these hard to find cigars.  ...looking forward to trying them more with age.

title: Punch  Petit Coronations
review_text: Just tried one of these little turbos with my morning coffee.  It starts off rather mild,but the spices kick in about a third of the way through. All in all a great smoke for most occasions.

title: Punch  Petit Coronations
review_text:
Buenos dias,
excelente cigarro de una fumada de 45 minutos con una fortaleza media pero muy sabrosa.
Las unidades probadas se presentan ya en tubo verde.
Recomendado a cualquier hora del dia.

title: Punch  Petit Coronations
review_text: smoked on vacation right out of tube and so the draw was hard,Ok flavour but will not buy again.

title: Punch  Petit Coronations
review_text: A good 40 mins smoke, construction is fine, good draw, quite smooth, earthy and a bit sweet with little spicy finish. short after taste.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas
review_text: great cigar, for the price, after the first third.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas
review_text: This one came as a real surprise... A real NICE surprise.. Came from a box from the fall of '07, so we're looking at about a bit more of 2 years aging.  When I took my time I was able to get a sweet old fashioned cigar flavor.. started a bit harsh but all that did was told me to slow down and I was rewarded for my patience.  Slight vanilla, chocolate at times..... Very affordable cigar.... I'd recommend it for an early in the day smoke!!!

title: Punch  Petit Coronas
review_text:
kawasaki
punch petit coronas(NO del punch)box code deb feb'07 ...purchased in varadero in jan'10.

if they ever were discontinued...they have been resurected.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas
review_text:
kawasaki
punch petit coronas(NO del punch)box code deb feb'07 ...purchased in varadero in jan'10.

if they ever were discontinued...they have been resurected.

title: Punch  Palmas Reales
review_text:
I bought two different boxes. The year 1999 ( ECA CCUD - factory h. Upmann)have a standard ring B (brown) in cellophane bag. Building a good, firm body, the exact shape, at times veined wrapper like milk chocolade. Profile is not really Punch.The ash was dark gray, burn well and seems to me complex, mild to medium. Taste and smell are just great. Like no machine made cigar. This one 9/10.
Second box (LOC AGT 01 - factory ERdM). Cigars are cellophane wrapping with standard ring A - red-gold (gold is sometimes green).This ones are medium,medium to full, more Punch, fresh flowers with woody-peppery taste. Contruction is inaccurate, rough, colorado claro wrapper. Ash is darker, hold about inch. Very satisfactory for MM. This one 8/10

title: Punch  Palmas Reales
review_text:
dont know were 2/5 for strength came from...my guess 3.5/5

had one tonight...very tasty..."Quite roasty, dried herbs and olives" is a pretty good description.nice smoke.

title: Punch  Palmas Reales
review_text: There are still many mid '90s through Millenium ones around which perform perfectly, partly because of coming in cellophane. Very unusual for Punch cigars, the taste is somewhat leaning towards a classic Upmann profile. Quite roasty, dried herbs and olives.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas del Punch
review_text: Excellent mareva.Easy draw,plenty of smoke.Flowery and spicy.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas del Punch
review_text: This was a nice cigar to begin with. Easy draw with a nice amount of smoke.  Light floral notes with a bit of sweetness in the first few draws. Flavour wise, the first third of the cigar had a smooth, light woody taste. The same flavours were present during the second third without much surprises. The final third displayed a bit of light pepper/salty notes with the wood flavours starting to mellow out.  The last third of the cigar had a bit of soft spot. Overall nothing too overwhelming or unpleasant. A nice smoke.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas del Punch
review_text: Nice enough looking smoke.... the cold draw showed some lack in construction,even burn but the looseness resulted in a hot smoke so had to be sure to make easy draws. A nice white ash that held up to 2 inches. Definite punch taste, fairly consistent throughout I thought. A pleasant enough cigar but was hoping for a little more than 2/5 in strength. Will be looking for another punch........... with a little more "punch"

title: Punch  Petit Coronas del Punch
review_text:
not happy tried 7 or 8 mainly tight draw couple I cut in half to see if that would help. dissapppointed as reviews are good and so were my expectations.
Much prefer tubed coronations far superior. also this box appear very thin for 42 gauage.

title: Punch  Petit Coronas del Punch
review_text: Very impressive Mareva indeed; good construction, uncomplicated draw. Creamy earthy smoke in the first third, peppery second third, unbelievable deep flavors with hints of dry fruits and nuts for the last part.

title: Punch  Northern Lights
review_text:
Only 1500 numbered boxes of this nice Petit Robusto were made in 2009. The only plaise you may find the cigar is www.sigar.com in Norway. Medium to full bodied cigar with nice creamines, frutines, some salt tones
wood and dark caffe.

title: Punch  Ninfas
review_text: Great smoke because it tasted great from start to finish.

title: Punch  Ninfas
review_text: Very enjoyable. Great draw with lots of smoke. Not pretty tasting, yet no bitterness. If " they don't make them like they used to" could be said about a habano, then this would fit. I awoke this morning with intentions of getting a few more. I smoked one last night.

title: Punch  Ninfas
review_text: Excellent flavor with impeccable burn. First half was leather, flowers,and honey. It stayed monotone until midway, when chocolate and twice the flavor and power appeared! I didn't want to put it down. Search these out!

title: Punch  Ninfas
review_text: Very hard to find, but even the last 2002 dress box versions smoked well. Very light and subtle, but a very nice, raisiny taste reminiscent of other Punch cigars. As with all these thin and subtle smokes, a cigar to really take one's time and concentrate.

title: Punch  Ninfas
review_text:
I love the look of these slender vitolas, I think they're much more elegant and sophisticated than the thicker formats so sought after nowadays.
This Punch is a fine example: fine, well stretched colorado wrapper, slightly box-pressed. The flavour, when still unlit, is of well aged tobacco, earthy and spicy.
The beginning of the smoke is immediately full, both in strenght and in flavour, mostly woody and leathery; had not been the Punch anilla, I would have said it was a Montecristo.
Going on, the flavour become smoother and rounder while the strenght is still at high levels; no trace of the sweet, honeyish taste of other Punch cigars. In the second third it increases to a greater level of complexity, when strong notes of pepper and cocoa jump in: really amazing, I was expecting a much "easier" and straightforward smoke.
The final third show a further increase in flavour and strenght, with more complexity added by a subtle sweetness, sort of a fruity flavour layer.
The draw was fine and consistent throughout the whole stick, while the burning required 3 or 4 corrections: given the format, I think it's acceptable.
This is a fantastic cigar, I strongly recommend it, just pay attention to smoke it after a meal, it's pretty strong.

title: Punch  Double Coronas
review_text: Creamy leather and earth flavours - couldhave been an amazing cigar if not for the terrible draw. How can a high level cuban cigar have such a tight and incompetent roll ??? It could have been an 8 or even a 9; becase of the awfull draw, it will be just a 6 (mostly because the aftertaste remains for some time; otherwise, it would be an even lower grade) !!!

title: Punch  Double Coronas
review_text: These are okay and not as good as Hoyo DC's.  They are lighter and have uneven burns.  I wanted to just love them, but they are sort of disappointing and I have not aged them too long for this reason.  Check out yourself, but I have not had a great relationship with these.

title: Punch  Double Coronas
review_text: Aug2000- mellowed out , waves of ripen fruit , creamy smoke texture .consistent down to final third . very enjoyable .

title: Punch  Double Coronas
review_text: Very good DC, i can say nothing bad. Medium to full in strenght. Myube later willbe even better.

title: Punch  Double Coronas
review_text: FR NISU - Blackcurrant, fresh cherry, and a beautiful finish of orange zest, balanced by sandalwood. This is a bright Punch, and tells a lively, youthful story as if of a boy on a quest for greatness. A very fun Double Corona.

title: Punch  Exquisitos
review_text:
I picked up a box of these nicely aged FR NIUA (1987) machine made cigars. This little cigar would not win any beauty contests. The bands were discolored and it looked to me as if there had been some kind of ink running. A friend explained to me that with this extreme age, and with these cigars enclosed in cellophane, the oils had risen to the wrapper and discolored the bands. The cellophane was yellowed and things didn't get any prettier when I pulled the cellophane off. This cigar was mottled with dark spots and in some places the wrapper was coming a bit loose. I did my best to gently wet down the loose wrapper and then readied myself to smoke.

I clipped the pointy (not rounded) cap and fired the cigar up. It had a medium draw and it burned straight and true despite the fact that I was outside with a bit of wind.

Previous Punch cigars that I have sampled have been too mild for my taste, but this cigar hit me like a slap in the face with a pleasant surprise right from the start. I got an immediate strong burst of cooking spices and a little bit of pepper, VERY full flavored but with mild-medium strength. The spicy taste was not sweet but was very enjoyable. This intense flavor was augmented by greater strength and tobacco taste during the middle third of the cigar. The spicy peppery taste continued. with a little growth in the pepper, during this middle portion and it reached a medium-strong strength level, but was never bitter. During the final third, the spiciness diminished and the strength increased, and I had a nice, bold, flavorful cigar that I smoked down to the nub.

As I mentioned above, this cigar had a few places where the wrapper was a bit loose. This was noticeable during the final third of this cigar. While I had removed the band carefully, this small trauma to the band caused it to unravel a fair bit during the final portion of the smoke. But this was a minor nuisance, I was able to hold the loose band in place and this cigar burned and tasted like a dream all the way.

In summary, this was a great little cigar that had unexpected flavor and strength for a machine made Punch cigar. This was a very nice cigar that was a real pleasure. And just the aura of smoking a 19 year old cigar that I didn't have to pay an arm and a leg to get added to the fun for me.

title: Punch  Margaritas
review_text: The best cigar (value for money).

title: Punch  Margaritas
review_text:
Once again i have to speak for this little gem. I have now smoked several of these and haven't had a bad one yet. No draw problems and it even burns evenly. 
Nice punchy flavors but it shouldn't be smoked too fast (ok, probably no cigar should be smoked too fast, but it sometimes makes me wonder when so called "experts" claim a cigar such as the partagas shorts last for 15 minutes, I can smoke a cigarette longer than that, well almost). 
THe margarita is always a good companion. I can't get no satisfaction? Yes , I can!

title: Punch  Margaritas
review_text: It seems this cigar has very little press wherever I look, perhaps others pass it by because it's inexpensive and too close to a cigarillo. Admitedly my palette is still quite limited but I did enjoy this, and will probably purchase more.  It starts with the usual woody tobacco notes but quickly develops into fizzing sweetness, like citrus fruit or sherbert, for a good portion of the first third.  As you move into the middle it starts to taste like tea, which was quite pleasant, before the sweetness makes a return and they both form a very refreshing combination.  Unfortunatly the final third was nothing but harsh, though I got the sense of something lurking behind it so these might have good ageing potential ( surprisingly! ).  An excellent, if slightly undemanding, casual smoke for those who don't want to sacrifice quality.

title: Punch  Margaritas
review_text: I was surprised to see that there weren't that many reviews for the margarita, because this is a very nice cigar. I just got a box and was of course eager to try one. Very nice flavor and aroma, medium to full in body with nice peppery and earthy character. A interesting fruity note comes through quite evident and it lingers nicely. It takes some time to get use to the thin gauge, as it's quite a different feel from the other, bigger ones. The draw is also different and it takes some time to adjust to that as well. Once you do however, you find a very nice little cigar, which not that many seems to notice. Well, I like that. I like to discover small, somewhat overlooked things which rewards you for noticing them. And the margarita does. A very underrated cigar.

title: Punch  Monarcas
review_text:
Smoking a 1998 Punch Monarca is like smoking the essence of Punch brand, with all that comes with it - 10/10 is an understatement -1998 Punch Monarcas are classics, if stored properly, and only that.

1998s are the only way to go, if aged  properly - the last of the Mohicans! and a  Classic!

title: Punch  Monarcas
review_text: from a box of 1998. Will never understand why HSA had discontinued these cigars - it is a symphony of Punch - wood with cherry cordial flavors that linger for hours and hours. A nostalgia classic Churchill, a perfection in itself.

title: Punch  Monarcas
review_text:
Since reviewers of this cigar have come under review quite a lot recently, I would like to get back to reviewing the cigar!    Personally, I don't believe a cigar in a tube ages that much, if any at all. It is my belief that a tubed cigar is supposed to be enjoyed for its freshness as supposed to an aged boxed or cabinet cigar.  
This is my second review, the first being late 06.  It is still from the same box of 04/01.  As you can see I do pace myself on this cigar as they are not as readily available as most churchills.  It is a shame as this is truly a magnificent smoke and remains one of my favorite churchills.  My recent experience has shown this to have much more charactor than a RJ and perhaps on par with Upman Sir Winston and Mornacas.

title: Punch  Coronets
review_text: Smoked one after a barbeque, and I was very impressed.  I'm not sure if this is the specific cigar I smoked but the length and ring gauge fit the description.  Mine had a maduro wrapper, and reminded me a lot of a macanudo maduro, except with spicy and nutty undertones.  Definitely recommend this one

title: Punch  Coronets
review_text: very good...

title: Punch  Coronets
review_text: Although I've enjoyed these in the past this cigar is outclassed by the Petit Coronation.  If you like cigars in this vitola it's a fine smoke but there are others mild panatellas worth trying. (Particularly the Rafael Gonzalez)

title: Punch  Coronations
review_text:
New to cigars, less than one year, and am partial to a mild-medium in the Corona size. I have been smoking various Dominican and Nicaragua cigars made with tobacco from the Latin American countries.

On a recent trans-atlantic cruise, I purchased five different 'brands' of Cuban cigars in Bermuda and Gibraltar and after 5-months in a humidor I have begun to try them with a Punch Coronations Tubos being one of them.

What I have notice most is that it is not the strength of a Cuban cigar but that they have a deeper-richer-bolder longer lasting flavor than a non-Cuban cigar.

This particular Punch Coronation was a medium+ with a consistent woodsy flavor for the full 60 minutes. IMO, the strength and flavor is similar to a Dominican made Montecristo No. 3 or Cohiba Red Dot.

Yet to be evaluated are Bolivar No. 1 Tubos, H. Upmann Coronas Major Tubos, Romeo y Julieta Romeo No. 2 Tubos, Romeo y Julieta Mille Fleurs, Montecristo Petit Tubos, Montecristo No. 3 and Montecristo No. 4.

title: Punch  Coronations
review_text: Some ones very nice, but there is too mutch bad ones in same box. Use to be one of my regular smokes. I might have had some bad luck, but i have find all the doners from these - tunneling,harsnes,tight or lose, bad flawor and no good taste.

title: Punch  Coronations
review_text: I got a single green tubos. Wrapper war ugly with spots of oil tobbaco leafs. Medium in strenght.

title: Punch  Coronations
review_text: Finished a box of 25 green tubes that I got from Beirut DF. All have consistent colour, size, and constuction. Very well formed. Medium in strength. Hints of Spices and Leather. Good value of 130 USD/Box. One big problem thought... the draw was awful!!

title: Punch  Coronations
review_text: Just tried my first Punch......absolutly excelent!!!

title: Punch  Cigarrillos
review_text: Excelnte. es un cigarrillo pero con mucho poder, de gusto algo picante pero que es una delicia. Recomendado para despues de cenar es un verdadero Punch!

title: Punch  Coronas
review_text: I can sort of see why this cigar got such a low rating. I think it is due to high expectations of the Punch brand. I'm a Punch lover, and this cigar objectively did not taste a lot like the other Punch vitolas. This was very spicy and leathery with litte cream to speak of. However, the flavour it did produce was wholly satisfying. And though there wasn't much flavour development, the smoking experience was nice, laid back and easy. Body was mmed-full. I would recommend this as a cheap go-to smoke.

title: Punch  Coronas
review_text: Incredibly woody.  Certainly full bodied.  The draw, construction and burn of these is excellent.  The wood notes seem to distract from the other flavours.  This is a full bodied cigar.  This cigar seems to be the least like the other Punch cigars I've smoked.  It's a good cigar but I'd have to admit being slightly disappointed.

title: Punch  Coronas
review_text: Superb. Box of 25. Good wrapper construction with rich-brown color & earth aroma. Smoked 1st of 25-exceeded expectations. Delicious light-spice ginger flavors 3/4 of cigar. Last 1/4 of cigar intensified. Nubbed cigar after 4 ashes. NO-SU-SS-M.

title: Punch  Coronas
review_text: A mild and easy cigar, that has its value for when you want something simple, but good. Nothing special, maybe unidimensional, but great burn and construction with a beautiful white ash.

title: Punch  Black prince
review_text: This without a doubt one of my favorite cigars. 11 years aged and smoked perfectly. I am not the biggest Punch fan but the Black Prince is without a doubt one for the ages. I only wish I could have boxes of these to enjoy!!!!!

title: Punch  Black prince
review_text: This without a doubt one of my favorite cigars. 11 years aged and smoked perfectly. I am not the biggest Punch fan but the Black Prince is without a doubt one for the ages. I only wish I could have boxes of these to enjoy!!!!!

title: Punch  Black prince
review_text: I had bought 6 pcs to try it. Didnt know the date. Not so memorably cigar. Averange taste, woody, earthy with some harshness. Construction, burn good.

title: Punch  Black prince
review_text: a spicy wooden flavour which provides the atomospher with wounderful and relaxing smell Aroma,.. the cigar has a very fine draw,.. i got lucky with the cigar i had it was a little bit oily Punch Cigar (it showed when i removed the brand label).. Excellent is my overall impression about this Black Prince Corona

title: Punch  Black prince
review_text: Got a whole box with a little bit of luck last week (August 2009). Now I have another good friend. Because the cigar is matured to creamy taste with abscence of any strength. Good burn. Tobacco is not so present as in D'Corona, but yes there is an Punch taste. No regret at all getting them. I love it.

title: Punch  Belvederes
review_text: Picked up a box in Switzerland. This beautifully aged longfiller has everything I expect of a cigar to accompany my afternoon coffee. Of course the belvedere format is not your choice for after a heavy dinner so it would be quite unfair to compair the Punch Belvederes with let's say a Punch Punch (Corona Gorda). For me this is a straight 10.

title: Punch  Belvederes
review_text: I found a box in Spain. Machine made cigar with good contruction and burn well ( better than RA Belvederes). Blend is not typical for Punch, in my opinion. More woody, dry subtle fruity flavour. Medium in flavour , strenght.

title: Punch  Belvederes
review_text:
I just smoked one of these this evening. Judging from the overall appearance (pointy cap, cellophane), these seem to be machine made, probably short fillers.
Still, they are pretty well made. Not underfilled, good draw and burn with surpisingly dark ashes. Once lit, it never went out and burned over half an hour. 
The cigar was medium in flavour, resembling other Punch cigars in the lower size range, which I think was rather nice. Also the smoke was smoother than I expected. 
Overall a good value for the price (2,30 Euros here in Germany).

title: Punch  Churchills
review_text: EL OLSC - This is a hybrid Punch Churchill. There is an imprint of El Laguito philosophy here, as Tamayo's direction and QC whisper through the blend maintained at FR. This is a decidedly softer Punch in terms of fortaleza, but fattened with wonderful bright-spectrum Punch flavors of fresh cherries, black currants, orange zest, and just enough ligero to keep it from being flabby on the palate. Of course, the signature El Laguito finish of sweet cream and waxy vanilla are there in spades to delight the smoker to a finger-burning end. An incredible specimen, and a real treat if found.

title: Punch  Churchills
review_text:
Balanced, mild and pleasent smoke, but lack of the personality that almost all punch cigars have.

Is a very good smoke, do not misunderstand me, but will not drive you crazy. Due the discontinuation of this stick, all boxes have a minimum of 4 years of aging.

title: Punch  Churchills
review_text: Beautiful, balanced, complex... top level tobacco.

title: Punch  Churchills
review_text: Little aroma prior to lighting but this cigar comes on in a hurry with full-bodied flavors and progressing complexity. Subtly different from other Punch cigars but very good all the same.

title: Punch  Churchills
review_text: Fantastic cigar. Starts sweet and woody. A masterful blend that switches into a lovely middle of full tobacco taste and mild end.

title: Por Larranaga  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Update to my Feb 2014 review... Yes, I believe the hype now... it took my boxes a few more years to show their true potential, and they are quite amazing... Approaching the Magnificos and surpassing the RdL... Bravo! 9.3 with potential of 9,5 to 9,7...

title: Por Larranaga  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Only thing to say is EXCEPTIONAL !

title: Por Larranaga  Regalias de Londres
review_text:
This stick is hitting on all cylinders, this is what cigars should measure up to.
Highly recommended.

title: Por Larranaga  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Good cigar, but not the best in the world... I agree with Gray, the Robustos de Larranaga is better, along with the Magnificos. However, the sweet, distinct flavors make this a top 5 cigar...

title: Por Larranaga  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Okay, good, soft and digestible cigar, but not the gate of Eden. Sure, for regional edition is a successful release. Personally, I like more the same year regional in Germany (Robusto), and much more the Asia Pacifico 2007 release, Robustos de Larranaga.

title: Por Larranaga  Picadores
review_text: The new edition of Picadores has. 48 ring gauge and it is just wonderfull. An one hour smoke with plenty of flavour (tons of wood and sweet) and reasonable draw. Great ciger if left on the humidor for a minimum time of 4-6 months. Not like the PC tha need 3-5 years !!

title: Por Larranaga  Picadores
review_text: I found these at the National Hotel in Havana, I have smoked 6 out of the box of 25 and so far they all have been great cigars. The wrapper is just oily enough to give these a beautiful rich tobacco flavour. I'm heading back to Cuba in a few days and I will definitely be searching for more of these. Highly recommended.

title: Por Larranaga  Picadores
review_text: This is one great cigar for the price. Close to siglo II but half the price. Start medium to strong but then gets milder medium body.

title: Por Larranaga  Picadores
review_text: The Picadores are back. They're a Hermosos #4, and have a distinctive new wrapper. I've smoked three or four so far. All have been sweet and had a pretty heavy dose of the PL caramel, with a heavy overlay of clean tobacco. They are reminiscent of a young H. Upmann with caramel and sweetness added. They have a lot more oomph than my PL PCs which I am very pleased with. I think they are a promising cigar. PLs usually need 3-5 years to be ready to smoke and these fit that pattern. I'm going to stockpile and come back to them, I'm rating them a 7 for now, but expecting them to be outstanding with the right aging.

title: Por Larranaga  Picadores
review_text: seems like these are back in production again. found them in store here in Edmonton Alberta. smoked one straight from the shop's walk-in humidor. as i did not have time to dry box the draw was a bit tight to my liking, but not plugged. still managed to get enough smoke to enjoy the cigar. it had a decent flavor profile, the typical notes you get from a cc - earth and mild grass notes. not very complex, might be best enjoyed as a morning smoke.

title: Por Larranaga  Panetelas
review_text: May 2016 box, even tough they are rather young, mild but flavorful, will get better with age, definitely a must have for fan of the brand it won't disappoint in any way.

title: Por Larranaga  Panetelas
review_text: Floral,sweet, last third woody with leather and a hint of coffee/earthy note,3rd part reminds me cuban cigar.Not complex,very mild!

title: Por Larranaga  Panetelas
review_text: Sorry... I forget: mild, floral and nutty. Simple aroma and not complex.

title: Por Larranaga  Panetelas
review_text: Overlooked cigar. One of my goto quickies! A must have for price point and flavor.

title: Por Larranaga  Panetelas
review_text: AUM MAR 15 - Smoked whole box, very consistent. Dark, rough wrappers and draw firm but workable. Excellent, steady and even burning for nearly all sticks. Strength 3/5, becomes 4/5 in last 3rd. Classic PL flavors clearly present but subtle, no doubt due to only 5-month-old sticks. Caramel and sweetness in the background but should move to the foreground with age as PL tends to do. Cuban twang is there. No harshness or tannic flavors. Becomes noticeably richer in last third. Very smokeable now and will improve. Outstanding value and ordering more. 91/100

title: Por Larranaga  Petit Coronas
review_text: This is one of my favorite everyday cigars. They are good fresh and are sublime with 5 years of age if you can wait that long.  If you can wait you will be rewarded with awesome caramel flavor. * 2014 is the last year available in the box code drop down menu. I am currently enjoying a cab from Feb '15.

title: Por Larranaga  Petit Coronas
review_text: My favourite mareva, at par with the siglo 2. Light to medium in strength, medium body with generous amounts of smoke. 1/3 takes time to pick up in flavours. First few puffs are earthy tobacco and then suddenly cramel sweetness start easing in. Within 2 puffs the caramel takes over the party coating my mouth and dominant in the retrohale. It continues to echo clearly in the finish even when all other flavours ebb away. 2/3 is more of the same caramel sweetness along with coffee beans and leathery tobacco. The burn is a bit wonky and have had to relight twice - but then thats me and all cigars. I smoke super slow to keep the stick cool and the flavours at max. A mareva is easily a 1 hr smoke for me...i stretch a robusto for the better part of 2 hrs. 3/3 is more of the signature plpc sweetness alomg with cappucino and aged tobacco. Occasionaly i detect hay and barnyard on the retrohale. The plpc are always great cigars never showing any bitterness or youth even when fresh out of the factory. My 50 cab is half way through and am already thinking of getting another from Paris to put down for aging

title: Por Larranaga  Petit Coronas
review_text: I love the PL profile. At its best it is full of rich sweet caramel, honey, and toast. I've had this cab for four years and it has just not measured up. It has nice flavor but it's mild and faint. These have gotten smoother with age but they just lack the oomph that I had in a previous cab. Still a worthy cigar and at its best, a treasure.

title: Por Larranaga  Petit Coronas
review_text: i love the marevas and definitely this is possibly the best you can smoke in this format.from the prelit you can smell coffee and dark choco and after lit honey sugar and caramel.it gets a tad too plain ca middle of 2nd third but then picks up again and finishes with you burnig your fingers to smoke the last centimeter.great cigars.

title: Por Larranaga  Petit Coronas
review_text: I wanted to like this cigar sooo bad! Ive heard so many good things about them soo i bought 10 from a cab from 2010. the draw was the best thing about them. they were rough on the eye and harsh on the palate. Im going to leave them in my humidor for 6 months and try again

title: Por Larranaga  Magnificos
review_text: smoked one in 2015. this is truly a great cigar right from the start!. this is not a powerful smoke but a classy, finesse cigar with complex flavors. lush, rich and well balanced. its got years to age and will only get better. score 9.5

title: Por Larranaga  Magnificos
review_text: EMA SEP07 - Hunters & Frankau was apt to name this the Magnificos. There is a wonderful background story regarding the history of this release by Simon Chase, and it should be researched by curious smokers. This cigar announced itself to the world last year, as it started firing on all cylinders. Currently, the previous tannins of youth have subsided completely, and it is a mongrel of a smoke. Forceful and intense Por Larranaga flavors blind the smoker with pleasure for hours on end, and the quality of its smoke - like clouds of greatness that one wishes to swim through. There is simply no substitute. Well, maybe Magnums!

title: Por Larranaga  Magnificos
review_text: Brilliant classics already, Por Larranaga taste unmistakable - PL Magnums inspired those and what an inspiration! 10/10 - Classics!

title: Por Larranaga  Largos de Larranaga
review_text: I had one the other night from the 80's. Great cigar and very PL. wish it wasn't my only one but the search is on for more.

title: Por Larranaga  Lonsdales
review_text: Amazing cigar! I tried one a few years ago, and was not impressed. I am so glad I kept this box... This is the best cigar I have ever smoked. Sweet, spicy, creamy and an amazing finish that lasts forever...

title: Por Larranaga  Lonsdales
review_text: This review is also for the German Regional. This was a perfect cigar. Rich tobacco, tons of caramel and honey, creamy and delicious. 100 points.

title: Por Larranaga  Lonsdales
review_text: Glad I waited with these. One of the best regionals I've had. Sweet, smooth, potent flavors delivered from a perfectly constructed cigar.

title: Por Larranaga  Lonsdales
review_text: This is also for the German regional. After 9 years, this one is simply amazing. Bon is correct, a classic in the making, if not already there. Sweet, smooth and rich flavors that change constantly. Glad I waited to try these. 9.5/10

title: Por Larranaga  Lonsdales
review_text: German RE 2006 Brilliant development after eight years - simply delicious, with sweet and toasty flavors - a classic in the making - highly recommended!

title: Por Larranaga  Lolas en Cedro
review_text:
It has sadly been discontinued in 2002 and remaining stocks have been cleared out already.
I have only tried some 2001 production ones. They kind of are "bumpy" machine mades, but very appealing to those who like Por Larranagas.
It is by far the most woodsy PL I have tried so far, even woodier than the Montecarlos. They have the delicate PL- caramel sweetness which is balanced by the oaky, cedary and almost resinous aromas.
Not sure, but the cedar sheet might impart some of that character.
It is indeed quite strong, comparable to latest release Petit Coronas or even a tad bit stronger.
Some boxes have been lost due to molds growing under the cedar if not properly stored...

title: Por Larranaga  Lolas en Cedro
review_text: The only pleasure I got of this one was buyin it and hoping it will be good. The draw was inexistent, as good as drawing from a chop stick. Not even half way through, the cigar exploded and the wrapper was gone. Before even cutting it, the cap looked like it was done by a 3 year old torcedor. Such a shame that the nice presentation of this cigar doesn't allow you to really inspect it before buying a single. I'm really disappointed, especially after reading the nice reviews. Knowing that it can be that bad, I'm not ready to give it another chance.

title: Por Larranaga  Lolas en Cedro
review_text: Very elegant cigar. Your friends will not be dissapointed if you offer them such a cigar, with its wonderful plastic packaging. But, do not smoke with empty stomach!

title: Por Larranaga  Lolas en Cedro
review_text: A deep and floral smoke.  Excellent construction for a MM. Must buy more.

title: Por Larranaga  Eduardos
review_text: " This cigar was discontinued in the 80's decade."

title: Por Larranaga  Eduardos
review_text:
I wish to buy a box of Por Larranaga cigars.
What is the diameter of this Por Larranaga Eduardos ??
Thanks

title: Por Larranaga  Coronas
review_text: This cigar is by no means discontinued, it  was actually rated this year as a top corona by C.A. magazine. These cigars are     great light smokes, that are in my opinion the best out there for this format.

title: Por Larranaga  Coronitas
review_text: good cigar, good price, day by day cigar

title: Por Larranaga  Coronitas
review_text: I was lucky enough to find a box of these hidden in a small humidor in Oakville, Ontario not too long ago. These are a harsh cigar and would best be used for an after dinner smoke. They have a nice draw and a nice ambiance but i find they can really pack and unwanted punch. Worth buying if you can find them.

title: Por Larranaga  Encantos
review_text:
Gorgeous 
. getting better and better 
A straight 93/94 now

title: Por Larranaga  Encantos
review_text:
#11 got it. Very bland at this moment. I`ve tried four cigars from two boxes with different box codes. Pretty much no taste at all. They say PL in general needs time and I surely hope these will improve as time goes by. 
If you are planning to buy a box consider buying a couple of singles first if possible. 
All in all these aren`t bad cigars and I know some people who really like these but I guess these just aren`t for me at least not yet.

title: Por Larranaga  Encantos
review_text: Just a let down to say the least. Bland, bland and more bland. I keep hearing these need more time. Won't waste my time or money on these.

title: Por Larranaga  Encantos
review_text: High expectations.Was not impressed a bit. One dementional. Won't be searching these out. There are far better Habanos for far cheaper. Smoked a Sancho Panza Belicosos yesterday with very low expectations that wowed me.

title: Por Larranaga  Belicosos Extra
review_text: Smoked one last night.Except from a little burn problem this cuban was an interesting blend of aromas that started subtle and ended intense.i still think it needs some time in the humidor to show it.s true potential.

title: Por Larranaga  Belicosos Extra
review_text: just bought 5 of these babies...can.t wait to try one

title: Romeo y Julieta  Short Churchills
review_text: These are very fruity with hints of cherries. Make sure you are grabbing the ones with the reddish hue wrapper. They have more flavour and sweetness with that classic RYJ blend. I had some duds but those were with the light brown wrappers. Mind you not all light brown wrappers were bad but from my experience that is when you are gambling with those cherry and sweet hints. Otherwise you will still receive earthy and somewhat rich tobacco flavours on your 2nd 3rd.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Short Churchills
review_text: This 1 is from a Tubos 3 pack I purchased from BKK duty free. The fragrance was a divine mixture of plum, cherries and reminded me of my uncles barrel aged port wine. Volumes of delicious fruity smoke with a creamy leather finish. Draw,combustion and burn was excellent.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Short Churchills
review_text: these have been aging in my humidor, since purchase in 08. great draw, one of the most even burns I have had. Hints of cream, nuts, and slight cherry. Very good smoke. cannot wait to have it with a different pairing as my coffee was not great, on the cold side... 9 more to go.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Short Churchills
review_text: Over the course of a few years and multiple boxes I say these are always well presented, generally very consistent with good appearance, construction, draw, burn and importantly flavour. Well priced and recommended. Light- medium with mellow R&J characteristics which include a complex mixture of fruits, berries, creamy leather some exotic woods and spices too, all making an appearance at various stages through out the smoke - also fine to smoke straight out the box :)

title: Romeo y Julieta  Short Churchills
review_text: Enfekho

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos
review_text: this is the bomb,,best

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 1 de Luxe
review_text: Milder in the first and second part.Woody sweet flavour.Little bitter in the third part with tobacco taste.Good cigar for a trip.No burn problem.my was in silver tube. Dont know the year.Was three years in humi.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 1 de Luxe
review_text: Fabulous cigar - full and rich without being too dense. Burns beautifully, and from the moment you light you know you've struck gold. Puts overpriced other brands to shame...

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 1 de Luxe
review_text:
This was a new experience for me as a "dyed in the wool" Monty smoker. The flavours were rich and satisfying for the price. Here in Australia we get the tubos marked in white, and even if stored improperly the cigars themselves should be in perfect condition. Although machine made these showed considerable care in construction to my way of thinking. Having placed one in the mouth (unlit) and just rolling it around for the "feel" of things, brought sweet tastes and some feelings of anticipation of times to come. My thoughts are that this is a wonderful smoke for what it is, and I will continue to have this brand despite some less than enthusiastic reviews.
In short, a fine Cuban with fine tastes and worth every penny that's spent. An excellent choice in any mans language.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 1 de Luxe
review_text: I just finished one of these from the new red and white tubes. What a treat it was. Good flavour, smooth draw and good amount of smoke for a 45 minute trip to heaven. I will definitely be stocking up on these. The ones from the old all silver tubes I found didn't smoke quite as well as the new ones do.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 3
review_text: Perfect evening, gorgeous lunch in a sushi bar.... Decided to finish with a "sledgehammer", purchased a RY. Was easy to light, burned well, its smoke was soft but not too rich. Loved the deeper tones of almond and nut, but the overall taste was - sorry - a little bit less than expected, as it was for me a bit dull. However, perfect choice for an evening walk in the springtime evening.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 3
review_text: Just got the box of 25, tried one and i can say that i`m not delighted but not disappointed also. Decent small and affordable cigar for everyday smoking after lunch or dinner. Draw was fine, no problem with filler which burn faster than wrapper that few experienced according to their reviews. This is definitely not cigar for full smoking enjoyment experience and some special occasion. average and decent everyday casual smoking with some RyJ charm.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 3
review_text: Smoked one last evening enjoying the view of my vineyards and found it very honest. Of course we are talking about a litle cheap cigar, but it is a decent flavourfull coronita. It is a good buy wich provides a good 40 minutes smoke.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 3
review_text: After my experience with this tubed romeo no 3, I would strongly suggest to avoid this cigar. The tobacco taste is overwhelming to the point where the real flavor is almost non-existent. Also, the price might look attractive, yet, El Rey Del Mundo "Corona de Luxe" or the Montecristo "no 4" is a better choice for the same price range. This RyJ is a cigar that reminds you that sometimes it is better not to smoke at all than to smoke "anything".

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 3
review_text: i wanted to know what is a coronitas? Is it a petit corona or a churchill or wat?

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 3 de Luxe
review_text:
I think that this a good cigar having purchased more than 2 boxes of 25.

It is not the best cigar I have smoked but it will do

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 3 de Luxe
review_text:
Hi All! This is my first review on this site. I am relatively new to cigar smoking. Since the beginning I have focused on smoking Romeo Y Julieta. I purchase these either from the local tabacconist or via the internet. I try to make sure that the cigars are well stored and not dried out. At home I have a small humidor for twelve churchills, which I keep at 72% humidity. 
I particularily like all of the RyJ which come packed in the aluminum tubes with the spanish cedar lining. The cigars come out with such a nice aroma. The Nr.3's are a nice little cigar with a full flavor of the Nr.2's but better for a quick smoke, about 30-45 minutes. The last few I have smoked have had a very even burn and a woody, sweet aromatic taste, just like all of the RyJ tubos. I still have not had any in the humidor for any amount of time, but these seem to have smoked well being new.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 3 de Luxe
review_text: Definate vanilla from the start then really nice spice  halfway through increasing in intensity - damn fine company. Can't agree with review 24, Piedra machine mades not in the same league. Hand rolled the only way to go.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 3 de Luxe
review_text:
There are consistency issues with the no.3...from really loose to very tight...overall a average cuban cigar..a good daily smoke before work in the morning. no complex changing flavour...just the good old cuban tobacco taste....
forgot to mention that I agree with the Webmaster that it's got a great aftertaste

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 3 de Luxe
review_text: I forgot to say that i dont like tubos cigars,i think that all of them have the same blunt,boring tuboish flavour,but i found the ryj n.3 much more better than all the other tubos i have tried.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 2 de Luxe
review_text: Nice and smoth, not too bold but very consistent. Available in most retailers even in the rural part of Porgugal.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 2 de Luxe
review_text: Not bad at all.Everyday afternoon coffe smoke.Sometimes not consistant min draw and burn but allways in flavor,which you will like or not.Always good to have a few,no, 1 and 3 the same thing but dif. vitola.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 2 de Luxe
review_text: I have tried couple pack of five.Good cigar. I love all this medium format.After three years in humi nice smoke. Sweet,woody,leather,spice in the end.Sometimes need burn correction.Only one was too tight rolled.Enjoyable cigar.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 2 de Luxe
review_text: This is my favorite standard cigar for a evening smoke with a single malt scotch. After being in my humidor for a long enough time, they are very soft and aromatic. Full of flavors and smooth. Draw is usually tight, although I make sure to only cut the bare minimum. The burn is sometime not even, but this could be due to my inexperience at smoking Habanas. All in all a great cigar.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeos No. 2 de Luxe
review_text: Allways nice to smoke this cigar. Perfect contruction and draw. Plenty of sweet, spicy and floral flavours. Never be dissapointed when choosing this cigar, good for all ocasions.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 1
review_text: huge dissapoinment i bought  this though i didnt have much money in hard times , i dont recommend anyone to have same feeling as i did .

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 1
review_text: Disgusting hard to keep it light and also nothing special to the flavors  I would never buy this again neither are  recommend  this to anyone. Waste of money

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 1
review_text: Nothing special, but is availability makes it a good choise at a resonable price...The last couple of those i had were not too bad.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 1
review_text: Ok cigar for beginners. Not bad at all, but lacks complexity and strength. I would not buy these again, maybe to a friend who is just beginning.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 2
review_text: This cigars are improving with consistency for the last year, constrution is very good, the draw excelent and flavours very nice.Notes of cherry and red fruits are very nice.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 2
review_text: Well constructed but bitter with no complexity, overall taste is average, nothing surpising. I prefer the Mille Fleurs for less expensive!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 2
review_text: On a recent trip to Cuba I picked up a number 2 with some change in my pocket. I didn't think much of it as it was just cheap cigar I  purchased on a whim. The cigar had some age to it but I thought it would just be a nice cigar to have casually rather than save it. And that I did, on a cold night I lit the cigar and had it with a rum and coffee. I was immediately hit unmissable notes of spice and pepper. This flavour intensified with some wood notes coming through. It was one of the best cigars I had ever smoked, and I even took it right down to the nub. I couldn't wait to get another one. Sadly I couldn't find any that aged again in the UK. So I bought a few boxer in 2015. I have just finished one of these after leaving them in my humidor for 2 months. Sadly without age these cigars just do not have that flavour profile that I was expecting. It had a few mild hints of leather and wood but not that spice I was craving from my aged no.2. If you are going to purchase these cigars I would recommend ageing them for a few years to really bring out those beautiful flavours.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Romeo No 2
review_text: One of the best every-day-cigars...! Its taste is round and complete! I love it very much! Every time really good quality so far! 10/10

title: Romeo y Julieta  Prince of Wales
review_text: This is, by now, a 20 years old cigar - the oldest cigar I ever smoked. The flavours are now very subtle, except for the intense creamy leather and some earth. Complexity of flavours is non existent, but It is very enjoyable untill the end, with perfect combustion and draw.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Prince of Wales
review_text: Abr98 A sweet, sweet, sweet cigar with hints of musk with a touch of earth -  intoxicating  is not the word - highly recommended, since RyJ brand is no more, in any representation

title: Romeo y Julieta  Prince of Wales
review_text: Smoked my first ever today. Wonderful cigar. Medium bodied, with some of the sweetest tobacco flavor I've ever tasted. I enjoyed this much more than any RyJ Churchill I've smoked.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de La Habana
review_text: Too bad these are discontinued.  I picked up a 5-pack in Costa Rica that must have been perfectly aged...these smokes are smooth yet robust!  They start with a sweet woodsy almost floral taste.  They burn slowly and perfectly til the last nub.  Since I've only smoked a few of the five I'll give this a 7!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de La Habana
review_text: Too bad these are discontinued.  I picked up a 5-pack in Costa Rica that must have been perfectly aged...these smokes are smooth yet robust!  They start with a sweet woodsy almost floral taste.  They burn slowly and perfectly til the last nub.  Since I've only smoked a few of the five I'll give this a 7!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Robusto LE 2001
review_text: Feliz Navidad Amigos. Merry Christmas All. This is my smoke for Christmas Eve after dinner. Superb cigar I never get tired of it. Hope Santa's sending me more Robustos R&J EL 2001.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Robusto LE 2001
review_text: Hola. This is the best Robusto I tried. I completely agree with Reviewer #14 when he says: The flavor profile was typical R & J with spice and cream, but there was much fuller body with greater strength. Well aged is a must, for me, even better than Cohiba Robusto.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Robusto LE 2001
review_text: Smoked one of these from a box that has been in my humidor for about 18 months.  The cigars looked absolutely perfect when I got them.  I smoked several of them shortly after I received the box, and, while not disappointed, they did not seem to be anything extraordinary.  BUT,after a proper time of aging,they are absolutely tremendous.  Smoked one this past weekend outdoors on the porch with a tall cold drink and the experience was outstanding.  Perfect construction, wonderful draw, loads of very aromatic smoke, and a razor sharp burn.  The flavor profile was typical R & J with spice and cream, but there was much fuller body with greater strength.  The last half of the cigar was heaven.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Robusto LE 2001
review_text: I've gotten some great smokes from this cigar during the past year. Clearly more consistent than the flagship Churtchills, possibly due to the LE designation. A very balanced and satisfying cigar.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Beautiful smoking, they are complex and well balanced. Excellent after dinner with regular evolution.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Small cigar, but very tasty.Very good to smoke in the winter months, because here in Portugal the winter brings a lot of rain and sometimes could, so i have to smoke inside my house, and a litle cigar is the best choise.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Wonderfull price, very nice litle cigar.Would update this review after smoking another one.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Regalias de Londres
review_text: Great value and generally ok, had a deal of 25 boxes and have smoked 10 of them. The dates vary from 2008 -2011. These are not fine havanas but if you are on a budget and like to smoke 6 or more a day they are very acceptable. The draw is usually very good and the flavour profile is a bit variable but on the whole a medium woody taste. The occaisonal one is superb. My score of 7 is based mainly on value and construction.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Superiores
review_text: I really enjoyed this cigar.  I picked it up in Hong Kong where you can still find them.  Great burn, good smoke.  It was overshadowed by the exceptional Por Larranaga Short Robusto Italian Regional that I picked up at the same time.  ...not sure why the Italian Regional was being sold in Hong Kong.  I regret not buying a box of the Quai D'Orsay but I see they are still available from some online vendors.  I think age will really bring a nice mellowness to this cigar.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Superiores
review_text: QdOrsay Superiores-ASIA PACIFIC 2011-Very young, needs considerable time to develop.No need to rate them yet. Herbal and sweet notes. Rather mild.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Superiores
review_text: My new favorite robusto and maybe even cigar!  This is a mild and complex 1 hour cigar.  I bought a couple boxes just based on a couple stellar singles.  Buy many boxes!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Superiores
review_text: OGA-05/11. Med-Full. Grassy, caramel and some bread tones. This robusto has a very oily wrapper and the cold smell is fabulous. Will be even better in the future.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Imperiales
review_text: A light to medium bodied and well made Churchill. Tangy tobacco flavors with a very discernible nutty character. Develops something of a light spice, wood, and floral quality to coincide with the other aforementioned characteristics. One has to really pay attention while smoking these to pick up the transitional complexity a good aged Imperiale can offer.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Imperiales
review_text: This was a beautiful cigar. Reminiscent of RyJ Churchills I smoked in the late 1990s. A taste and flavor I've been chasing for years. Earthy, peppery, and lovely! Hints of cocoa throughout. I'm in love with these. Old school Cuban taste.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Imperiales
review_text: See review 17...this cigar proves aging is crucial! Smoking one after 4 years of aging and it is magnificent! Perfect draw and firmly packed. The aromaa is intoxicatng- with flavors that quite be pinpointed. This was not an expensive box when purchased but sure equals any high priced Habano out there today.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Imperiales
review_text: I am in love with the recent examples of this cigar. I am currently finishing a Nov/09 box that has been spectacular. Partagas Light. Perfect for lazy summer afternoons.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Imperiales
review_text: A gorgeous Churchill from October 2010, beautiful colorado wrapper with perfectly finished cap. Starts with citrus, progresses with cocoa and cedar and continues with light pepper and earth. Medium body, long finish - delicious!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Panetelas
review_text: By far the richest cigar in the lineup, this cigar is nothing short of spectacular. Perfect draw and burn this cigar aged magnificently! A bit herbal and a hint of meat its the earth that I enjoyed most especially through the nasal exhale. Not sure when they stopped making these but if you can get your hands on some, DO IT!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Panetelas
review_text: Absolutely delightful cigar from 2007 - beautiful ninfa to look at with colorado wrapper, brilliant burn and delicious coffee flavors on a solid earthy base. A lazy afternoon cigar, elegant and refined.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Panetelas
review_text:
My second box.
Really,really great cigar.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Panetelas
review_text:
Fan of the Imperiales, but, I did not love these. Total lack of complexity... 

Perhaps I need to wait a few more years...

title: Quai d'Orsay  Coronas Claro
review_text:
Good draw, slightly on the light side.  Good ash, ashed twice both on the 2cm+ side.  Good relatively even burn.  
Relatively bland.  First third slight taste of white pepper.  Remained the same throughout the smoke although slightly more peppery in second and final thirds.  Needs at least 2-3 years more aging.  Not very complex at this stage.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Coronas Claro
review_text:
Relatively new cigar smoker and I have been trying a variety of cigars to see what I like.
The good. Good draw although slightly on the light side.  Good ash and only ashed it twice both at about 2+ cm.  Relatively even burn. Mild to medium in strength.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Coronas Claro
review_text: Very nice mild-medium cigar.  Starts mild and honey sweet then builds to medium.  Creamy and delicious..very consistent profile and burn.  Age extremely well.  Not bad fresh either... Perfect first smoke of the day, but good anytime.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Coronas Claro
review_text: Fantastic cigar- sweet, medium bodied, perfect for the morning. These do need some age though, as they were quite bland when fresh.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Coronas Claro
review_text: A good first cigar for the night as it is relatively light at the beginning but builds up to a modest flavour level near the end. Although not a strong smoke it has some very nice creamy notes and a good aftertaste.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Gran Coronas
review_text: A wonderful review no.9 by youngy88, a great cigar with much fuller taste, than anyone would expect, POS OCT06 - sweet, full flavor, perfect burn and....effervescence all over. Fantastic!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Gran Coronas
review_text: Smoking a fantastic example from 2001 RyJ factory. Wow what a great 2 hour smoke. Sweet smoke that is just so easy through the nose. I wish I had another box of these. What a shame this cigar is no longer made. My favorite vitola.

title: Quai d'Orsay  Gran Coronas
review_text: Absolutely unbelievable cigar from RyJ factory  2001 - the effervescence of sweet and more sweet flavors, like sweet chard and sugarcane - did I say sweet? Highly recommended!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Gran Coronas
review_text: When I start a full day of cigar-smoking at my favourite shop in Brussels, I usually start with a light cigar, such as this Quai d'Orsay. Mild flavours, light, perhaps too light for some of you. The price is right and the feel is good, however!

title: Quai d'Orsay  Gran Coronas
review_text: Smoked this about a week ago. Didn't let it age, smoked it right out the shop. Pretty bad burn, light, not too many flavours (and this isn't a good thing...). Looks nice though ;-)

title: Romeo y Julieta  Perfectos
review_text: Recently tried a few of these, before deciding whether to purchase a box at a cheap price I'd seen on the internet.  Very relieved I didn't buy the box before trying any.  Burn and draw problems with them all during first third of the cigar.  I normally like the RyJ blend but this was lacking in every way.  An unpleaseant burning wood taste is all I got through the whole cigar.  I will stick with the romeo 2's for an everyday smoke.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Princess
review_text: Have to disagree with some of the previous commentators. This is a cigar where I found no RyJ fruit whatsoever; only the floral side of RyJ profile. Also, these cigars age very slowly - bought 5 of them of a 2014 box and only now they seem to be smokable. The first ones were actually very very agressive (something not common on RyJ cigars). Also, this is a very expensive cigar for just 45 minutes of smoke. Do not recommend.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Princess
review_text: Really enjoyed this one. Started off with a peppery taste which evolved into a vanilla-cream flavour, followed by wood then toasted nuts. After that sweetness ensued then the pepper came back. Will definitely have this one again!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Princess
review_text: Really enjoyed this one. Started off with a peppery taste which evolved into a vanilla-cream flavour, followed by wood then toasted nuts. After that sweetness ensued then the pepper came back. Will definitely have this one again!

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Princess
review_text: Just tried one of these for the first time and can say I will be smoking them again. The construction was very good, compared to other cigar's of similar size it felt fuller. It had a great aroma that got me excited about smoking it. It lit well and burned consistantly not giving off much heat. The draw was perfect, with every draw it filled my mouth with pleanty of smoke and a sweet spicy flavour with a hint of vanilla which got stronger towards the end. All in all a very enjoyable smoke which I highly recommend if your looking for a 30-40 min smoke.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Princess
review_text: Box PUT 06, very good short cigar. Woody and fruity taste. Good draw, construction. Smooth and creamy smoke.Super for coffe break.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Julietas
review_text: very tasteful, best little cigar on the market probably

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Julietas
review_text: i just love these things.. 2nd one i've smoked since my resurrected passion for cigars 20 years ago. Smooth, flavoursome, burns nicely, good body but not too strong - and this time i managed to eave it after smoking two thirds.. usually my biggest sin. Delicious.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Julietas
review_text: Bought 5 boxes in Madrid last weekend, tried one driving to Plasencia and loved it.It is tasty, rich,and cheap.I am now smoking them in a daily basis.A Wonderfull 30 minutes smoke.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Julietas
review_text: I tried this twice this week. Very good size for a quick draw 10-15 mins, very suitable for in the middle break. Taste tend to be light though rated light-medium. Problem with this is difficult to draw despite of its small size. Smoke amount is far less than any other mid ring which makes me think it was not lighted at the beginning.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Julietas
review_text: Great small cigar if you dont have time for a big one. This cigar packs a punch despite its small size. A few were plugged but thats just the way it is with the entreacto format. Spicy, peppery, and slighty sweet, good cigar for the winter when you dont feel like freezing outside for an hour.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Piramides EL 2005
review_text: The EL selections can be quite hit or miss. This is a hit in my book. These are smoking very well right now and have an excellent RYJ flavor profile.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Piramides EL 2005
review_text: Reviewer #14, these EL cigars only come with dark maduro wrappers - the photo opposite is the same, it may appear to be a little lighter due to the flash from the photo. If your cigars were indeed the 2005 EL it could only be the most insignificant of lighter shades - but still maduro and relatively dark. Otherwise they were either counterfeit or regular Romeo y Julieta Belicosos and not these ELs. Presuming they were the correct cigars then any subtle variation in wrapper shade has no difference whatsoever on the flavour; even swapping a maduro wrapper itself for a claro wrapper on a large guage (same blend) Havana cigar would have little effect on even the most tuned-in palette. It all varies, with any fine cigar, on subtle variation in the overall blend, age, roll quality and also the smoker's own relativity/subjectivity. Once you get to things such as wrapper shade variation it becomes negligable, save for on very thin-guage cigars. Hope this helps.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Piramides EL 2005
review_text: Has anybody got these with lighter colored wrappers like the one pictured? Mine were lighter colored & Tasted of good R&J flavors with great aroma.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Coronas
review_text: Had 2-off these from sampler pack. The first was a decent smoke with classic RYJ flavour. The second was plugged with tight draw.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Coronas
review_text: Excellent cigar. Medium bodied and full flavoured, it is extremely smooth and balanced. Earthy, with wood and cocoa notes and somewhat dry. Nothing bad to say.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Coronas
review_text: Wonderful smoke. I'm a beginner to cigar smoking but I would totally recommend these.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Coronas
review_text: I heartily agree that this is an excellent choice for a beginner (me) to sample & compare. The flavor, aroma & burn quality  fully complimented the aesthetics of my 1st Belicosos. I plan to age the majority of this box & sample them annually.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Petit Coronas
review_text: My first Cuban cigar ever.  I have about 10 left from 3 years ago that I'm going to let age for a while.  Very nice smoke indeed.  Medium body flavour with some complexity.  Cedar, earth and coffee notes.  Great starter cigar.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Panetelas
review_text: I am waiting for the R&J Petit Piramides EL 2005.

title: Romeo y Julieta  Panetelas
